review_title: So Good the Post Officer Workers Might Steal It
review_content:
Received a torn open package, that was taped back up. All that was inside was the order slip when I opened it. Contacted Squatch Support, and they were very understanding and send an identical order right away, which arrived without tampering. 
 
The Pine Tar is fantastic, a bit scratchy though. It does leave a residue wherever it sits. 
 
Use a soap saver, as well as a loofah (man up and stop complaining you go through soap too fast when you have easy options like this! dark green and blue ones are a couple bucks at Walmart) to extend the life of this bar, since it is only 5 oz 
 
Will be purchasing from them again, great company and great soap. 5/5

This was in my very first shipment of soaps i ordered. I enjoyed the others as well, but this one has been one of my favorites. It has a wonderful cedar smell which gets stronger the more the soap is used. Which brings me to why it got a four star rating and not a five, the soap itself doesn't last long enough ! I actually just ordered another shipment and this soap is in it.

I finally gave up my electric razor for the traditional approach, and since I've been so happy with Dr Squatch's soap I gave the shaving kit a try. It is FANTASTIC! Just a little bit of water on the brush produces a thick, sudsy shaving cream that goes on well and leaves my face smooth for my wife. My kids like to watch me shave with it, because they say it looks cool. Even though I won't let the boys touch my razor yet, I have put some of the lather on my 7yo son's face and he loves the way it smells and feels as much as I do. 

And my wife--the one person I try my hardest to impress--loves the way my face smells and feels after I get done shaving each morning.

I've been so happy with this purchase I wish Dr Squatch had a razor club to go along with this kit.
Smells great! Feels great! Wife loves it!

I don't remember when I made the switch to liquid soap but I seen a add for all natural soap, I have tried the pine and driftwood. I don't know why I ever changed, I like the smell of the soap I feel clean and there is no after feeling just clean. I am looking forward to bay rum if it's like the other 2 that I have tried I won't be going back to the liquid soap and all its cemicals.
One word I have to say. Exceptional
Picked up some gold moss soap, and was impressed right off the bat. The scent was spot on, good size, and arrived promptly. Can't wait for my next order to come it. I definitely recommend it.
I dig this. Serious exfoliation going on. Eye opening smell. Feel very clean, all dead skin gone. Man soap.
Love all of the products I've gotten from Dr. Squatch. The pine tar is amazing.
Really nice shave and no more bumps. My skin is much softer and smooth.

Ordered a few bars as gifts and added one for myself. Usually I order pine tar but decided to try cedar citrus. Its good, just not pine tar. My boys will love the Gold moss I got them, but I have to go place an order for another pine tar so please excuse me.
Love the clean refreshing scent and how clean I feel .

Love the Bay Rum and Pine Tar so far the only 2 I've tried. 
I'm in the military. 
I'm a mechanic. 
I own chickens and a goat. 
I have 4 kids 3 of which are girls. 
Needless to say I shower a lot and normally don't care what soap I use so sometimes I end up smelling like a chick. 
This stuff smells like the good parts of the outdoors and does not dry my skin out. 
Most importantly my wife loves it!!!
Smells great.
Glad I tried this product, it's the greatest!
Did not like the way these colognes smelled.
This was a fantastic purchase. The soap has a strong yet not overbearing scent and it get's you very clean. 10/10 will buy again
It's great soap!
I think this soap is FANTASTIC! I only wish I could have found it sooner#
The smell fills the room
Would be 5 but the soap always sticks to wooden platform thingy!
I bought the pine soap last week and it has been wonderful, fragrant, and pleasantly lingering. Awesome stuff!

review_title: The fight to get my soap
review_content: Well it took me about two weeks to get it at about six or seven emails just to find out but hey every other day I was being told that it would be shipped out and it never did finally It did
The samples smell great, but they don't last on the skin at all
Not sure where that saying came from, but this soap sure does the trick. Pine Tar. Nuf-said.

I purchased the Eucalyptus Greek Yogurt bar several weeks ago. I have never used an all natural soap before and I'm happy I desided to venture into it. The soap is strong, fills the bathroom with it's scent and it is a lovely touch to the skin. Thank you I will certainly buy more in the future.

Great smelling soap with a scent that really lasts!
Great soap, leaves the skin clean and moisturized
The Bay Rum soap is great. I use it regularly. I tried the other soaps which are also good, but the Bay Rum is my favorite.

review_title: Soaps I have tried so far;
review_content:
The Bay Rum is my favorite I believe. I really like the smell and so does my wife. She didn't care for the Gold Moss. Using the Bay Rum reminds me of my childhood and getting Old Spice or one of those type products from my old fashioned Great Aunt. I know it sounds corny, but using this soap reminds me of a past when things were more "manly". It is a man's type smell and the soap just works so much better for showering than the other commercial made soaps. I used to use Lever 2000, but won't buy any of those again. Dr. Squatch is a superior product to any of the name brand soaps purchased in stores. You step out of the shower feeling good and clean and you smell like a man should. 
My next favorite and very close second is the Pine Tar. I didn't know what to think when I saw the black color but immediately enjoyed the smell and the coarse texture. It is a great soap. I may have to keep two bars in the shower at a time and switch back and forth. The Pine smell is great! Reminds you of the outdoors. (I have an outdoor shower too). The coarse texture reminds me of the old Lava brand soap my father used to keep out on the utility room sink for washing dirty hands. Great scrubbing ability, (we won't use the exfoliation word) or any other feminine terminology. The Pine Tar really cleans well and leaves you feeling fresh when you finish your shower. Awesome product! 
Using the Goats Milk, Sea salt now. I'll fill you in later. I used to have Dairy goats and my wife made a milk soap and would add ground up egg shells for texture, so I'm interested to try your sea salt version. 
Thanks guys

I avoided this soap for months, thinking it was produced by and marketed to only the younger hipsters with full beards. I'm past 50 now and as far from hip as I can be. I worry about things like death and taxes. But I like to smell good too. I relented and picked up a couple bars. The Pine Tar was up first, and it blew me away. The smell reminded me of my old trout fishing cabin from my youth. Once my reminiscences of a #18 Olive Dun subsided, I realized how fresh and non-filmy I felt. My wife greeted me at the bathroom door (THAT never happens) and said, "You smell good." She's smelled me plenty of other ways without commenting, so that was a bit miraculous on it's own. She rubbed my arm and said, "And you're soft too." Since my kids might end up reading this, I'll dispense with further annotations. Suffice it to say, I haven't enjoyed taking a shower this much since my teenage years.
I really enjoyed the scents of both the samples it is so hard picking between the two.
Your soap is fantastic and I love it, it serves incredibly well!!
The nicest smelling soap I've ever used. It is fantastic.
Smells good, looks like tar as the name suggests. Wish it lasted a bit longer, but maybe that's what happens with all natural soap.

Loved everything about it aside from its short life. Smells and feels manly...so manly in fact that it made my face fur sprout another 6 inches almost overnight. Unfortunately, it was all but gone in a matter of two weeks. Not my first bar of soap, so I know how to make em' last, but this attempt was in vain.

review_title: Get that Bay Rum in your life
review_content: I have liked all the products that I have purchased from the Squatch, but Bay Rum is such a manly scent that I have to shave my knuckles after every shower, which works out fine because I have joined a bare knuckle boxing league due to how manly this soap is.

recieved this cigar box as a gift and was so impressed with soap. the bay rum smells magnificent and i cant recommend it enough.. GREAT PRODUCT. 
 
p.s. can i get some free stuff for doing a review .. (doesnt hurt to ask) :)
trying to find a natural scent that my teen-aged son will wear. although i loved the scent samples that i ordered, they were not his favorite. so the search continues. thank you.

review_title: Magnificent Pine Timber Sent Surrounds All
review_content: All joking aside. This is a great product with excellent results and a sent that does not scream you're 14 years old.
Easy to order. Arrived on time. I ordered the Tar Pine and if I had one comment on it other than I like it €¦.it could last longer than 2 weeks.
Best I have used in the nearly 20years I have been shaving.

These smell good. There's one that I like enough to buy a full sized version of but I can't tell which one it is, since (other than a green dot on top) there's no other way to identify which is which... Five stars for smell, one deducted for lack of identifier

I recently purchased 2 bars of Dr Squatch. I got the Bay Rum and the Gold Moss Scrub (which was my favorite of the two). Both soaps smell great and really make my skin feel good. The scent is very nice, but not over powering. They both lather up nicely and leave the shower smelling great too. I highly recommend this product and can't wait to try some of the different scents.

The soap smells amazing, and the packaging was nice, however I did not get my tracking information when it shipped, and it was also delivered without the card/note that I had written, leaving the person I sent it to wondering who sent it. Kind of ruined the surprise a little.

review_title: This is a ruggedly handsome soap
review_content: I feel like I took a shower at Nick Offerman's house
I like the smell its a nice bar of soap..its tough to get off the soap saver..I think that if you guys could do a body wash I'd be up more for that!!

The soap is great - smells incredible. Zero complaints there. The only issue is that it's really expensive, especially when you factor in shipping. For how much you need to pay, I'd wish the bar were at least twice as large.
the aloe soap smelled great but left my skin with an almost sticky residue and I felt like my skin dried out .

Saw the ad on Facebook for the soap and read the ingredients for each bar along with the scents. Bought 3 bars and have started using the first. Love this soap and the fact that I am putting less chemicals on my body. Now if y'all would make anti-antiperspirant / deodorant. On my next order I might have to try the shave cream.

After stumbling across Dr. Squatch randomly, I'm so glad I did. Their soap is amazing. I usually buy both the Aloe and the Pine Tar, with the Pine being my favorite. Also, it's great for beards too! My beard comes out being soft and easy to handle instead of just being out of whack. I will keep buying their soap, so do yourself a favor and get yourself some soap from these guys.
Awesome soaps!
Cant live without these soaps!
I have thoroughly enjoyed your Pine Tar soap and cologne samples. I plan to reorder the soap (and other varieties) and a full-size cologne.

i baught the giftbox to try maost lall the most popular soaps. 
Im my opinion the pine tar is the best because it has the strongest scent. I also purchased the cologne sampels to try them out. I found them to have the most woodsy scent. Lets jurt ray that i am now going to be a lifetgne user. I plan to sign up with the soapscrption.

The Driftwood scent is one of the best things I've ever smelled - I sure wish it lasted longer. Within an hour or two you can't tell it was applied. Hemlock Trail dries down nicely, but packs too piney a punch when first applied.
Got two soaps for my husband to try. He loves them. This will be the only soap I buy for him now.

review_title: Fresh as a freshly showered Man-Squatch!
review_content: Love the texture and smell. A great start to the day!

review_title: Pine tar and gold miss scrub
review_content: Pine tar is awesome really good scent and gold moss scrub would be nice if it was a stronger sent but still like it.
I was looking for a better soap, and this did it for me. It's got a great forest scent that stays with you for the day. Gonna try other scents, good stuff!
I love the smell and the abrasive oatmeal. It just didn't last long. Before I know it it was gone and for the cost that was disappointing.
Working in the desert it's hard to find good soap to get all the sand out! Deep Sea Goats Milk gets me clean and leaves my skin feeling fresh and moisturized!
I bought the pine tar, bay rum, and citrus. I love them all.
The cheap prices can't be beat. This soap is nicer than soap i have spent $15 on at Lush.
I'm strongly considering becoming OCD so I can justify washing myself in Bay Rum multiple times a day. All four scents are amazing straight out of the box. Can't wait to try them all out.
loved the soap so much I've ordered twice now, if there was only some free colonge samples that came with it is probably buy that too .
Great Soap!!

review_title: No Longer Smell Like a Sasquatch
review_content: Mmmm €¦lather €¦much lather €¦woman says I smell good €¦woman happy €¦me happy €¦.and clean. Me buy more.
Great smelling. Bar too small.

review_title: Am Now A Pine Tar Believer
review_content: I was skeptical at first about whether Pine Tar was a scent that would even be enjoyable as a soap. I was then pleasantly surprised by how awesome this soap smells! I strongly recommend you give it a try.
Smells awesome, works awesome....gave only 4 stars due to the fact only used twice so far (need more usage time), and perhaps aroma could be a bit stronger!?....relatively mild.

review_title: Scent is great, but doesn't stay
review_content: I love the scent of this bar, the exfoliation is great, but the scent just doesn't stick around. Overall great buy!

I discovered Sasquatch Soaps quite by accident, but that's not important right now. Seeing that they're 100% natural, I decided to order the Bay Rum and Gold Moss as a trial. I'm 51, in good shape and health, but have been plagued by skin issues since puberty. I've always used the harsh acne soaps and treatments like the Oxy products, and they help but I can never seem to STAY clear. Since I started using the Bay Rum bar as both a face and body soap, my skin is clearer and I'm no longer using the harsh "cleansers" in what has always been a losing battle. Thanks to the 'Squatch, I look as good as I smell!
Dr. Squatch's soap rules. It doesn't leave that unnatural, uncomfortable texture on your skin that every other bar soap I've tried leaves, and it smells like heaven. Two giant, furry thumbs up!

i love this soap! Great smell. I can't wait to go workout so I can come home and shower!! Today I parked at worked and got out of my car and immediately was hit with the scent of my soap,,,looking up I saw a row of 4 tall pine trees!
I love this soap. I have tried several different scents and they are all great. Good service too. My skin thanks you. It's not as dry as with store brands. Refreshing start to my morning!
I love me some squatch soap, smells great and I feel really clean!
It's a nice scent, but very faint and dis not last long

This soap is thebomb.com and it keeps all my funbits clean and sparkly. So now I can go hog tyin', skim boardin', and sky divin'. And then go to the bar and still have a good looking woman take me home and not run away in fright once my clothes come off. Keep on keepin' on Squatch!

I bought some soaps for my boyfriend and so far bay rum is my favorite. When he walks by me I tell him to turn around and walk by again just go I can get another wiff. I'm for sure thinking about getting the automatic monthly orders.
i like it. is good.

Just got my order of 4 different soaps. I have started with Bay Rum, it is fantastic! The smell is subtle, but enjoyable and manly. I was worried about "that greasy feeling" some soaps give, like you are not getting all the soap off, but this has not been the case with your soap! Thanks for a great product, I can't wait to try the other bars I ordered. I will be buying more when I run low.
Fantastic soap. Lathered really well and it smelled fantastic. My only gripe is that it did not last long. I think I maybe got 4 or 5 showers done before it broke into too many small pieces.

1st time buying, love the fresh smell, great soap for all over body scrub 
keep Squatching
Nice size and variety with a nice box. Would buy again as a gift
smell good, feel good...
For the size of the 5oz bar I would expect it to cost less or for the bar to be larger. Great soap though. All natural, smells great, but it doesn't lady long enough.
This is a soap manly enough a grizzly bear would take a shower. Awesome product!!
I found out about Dr. Squatch about a year ago and have bought nothing else since. Very high quality soap.
I bought two soaps for a gift and they smell amazing! I chose Bay Rum and Gold Moss. Great quality soap for a good price!
Web page is fine but an app would be much easier to get to.
Best soap I have ever used! Love the pine tar and bay rum.
Smells very masculine and woodsy. It's a little rough, but it's supposed to exfoliate. And I like it a little rough ;-)
Really good quality soap, can't go wrong with this one!

review_title: Great alternative to store bought bar soap
review_content: Great soap! Lathers easily and exfoliates well. 2 suds up
LOVE THE CITRIUS SOAP, AND WILL BE BUYING MORE! DO YOU MAKE ORGANIC SHAMPOO?
This soap is great. Second time I buy from DrSquatch and I've yet to be disappointed. I stay smelling awesome.
Great soap love the rough texture. Eager to try all of the different kinds of soap you offer. Love the hustle guys!!!!

Recently purchased the pine tar and Bay Rum soaps. I have only used the pine tar and have to say it is fantastic! I have problem dry skin/eczema and this exfoliates beautifully and leaves my skin smooth...plus the scent is invigorating. Will definitely order again!
I bought the Pine Tar soap for my husband and he loves the scent and the exfoliation. I would just recommend buying 2 at a time since the bar seems to run out fast.

I needed something different than regular bar soap and shower gels, and Dr. Squatch delivers! Rich lather and clean rinsing plus I do really love the scent of the Gold Moss Scrub. You have a customer for life.
I love the kit and so does my face!!!! I am glad I purchased it.
Was so-so. Aroma was nothing special. Also disappointed since it was just a small (trial size) bottle.
Love the smell, love the scouring effect as a rub it over my skin, definitely a winner.
Good clean scent, rinsed away nicely.
Using this soap is like covering yourself in fresh citrusy awesomeness while the wind of a cedar forest caresses you. so it's pretty nice soap.
your review here
Hooray for soap!
Just used it and really liked it.
Great smelling soap. Makes a man feel clean too.
The Sop smells amazing and makes my skin feel refreshed and soft. Never felt as clean as i do until started using your soaps for a while now. Love the products. Keep up the amazing soap making

review_title: Best ever, and my newborn loves the smell
review_content: Good stuff

review_title: Addicted to the way this smells!
review_content: The abrasive feel of this soap was a little strong at first but I love the way it removes any dirt, grease, or dead skin from sun exposure. After a few days of using it, I'm addicted. I can't describe the smell... it's like sticking your nose inside a pine tree, but with a slight soapy clean smell too. This is the first bar Ive pulled out of my box containing 5 more soaps. I hope I like them all this much!

A previous review writer wrote that this bar of pine tar soap turns your weak human membrane into yeti armor. That couldn't be more true.. I've only showered with it once and already notice a difference in the smoothness and strength of my skin. The scent is beyond addicting. If I had one suggestion, I'd like the bar to produce even more of a scent than it already does because I just can't get enough of it. Superb quality here.... In fact, I started a subscription and backed their kick starter for their up and coming shampoo and conditioner right after I jumped out of the shower. 

You're onto something really special with these products.. I'm glad to see you're producing new lines of product as well. May I propose a fan request? Deodorant!

I came across the negative reviews as my soap saver was en route. When I received mine, I noticed two things: 1) it's REALLY lightweight, and 2) I decided to coat the top in a thin layer of olive oil to prevent the sticking complaint that was a recurring theme in the reviews.

Long story short, the soap doesn't stick whatsoever! However, when you read the description and see that this is crafted from California cedar, you get this image of a wooden brick that can look at home in a forest - pretty manly image, right?

Well, this thing feels like it's made of balsa wood. If it had a little more heft, it might command the $15 price tag. If mine didn't come in the sampler, I'd be ticked for spending that much for something that feels so 'limp.'

Overall, not bad!

review_title: Not what expected, extremely strong perfume sent.
review_content: I like the idea and feel of a all natural soap that lathers up nicely and has NATURAL sent. Unfortunately this soap has all of the above except a natural sent. The pine tar should smell smokey and piney, but it smell like perfume. If this soap had no added "fragrances" it would be exactly what I'm looking for.
Too spearminty for my taste and not enough basil. Makes me feel like I'm brushing my teeth. Nice texture to the soap though.

review_title: Nice smell but a bit aggressive on the pumice
review_content: The smell is great, very woodsy and manly. The pumice is a bit too rough and makes it feel like it may scrape up the skin in some tender areas (underside of arms, face).

This is great soap, dont get me wrong. The scent and exfoliation is very good. It rinses easy and leaves my skin feeling clean without a film. However, this bar has only lasted a week from daily showers. When the bar reached about a 1/2 inch in thickness, it broke into 4 small pieces. I'm a little put off about this. Please make these last longer as $6/week for a bar of soap is a little excessive.

Gold Moss Scrub is my first bar from Dr. Squatch. I love it! The scent is awesome and lingers long after the shower. I'm hooked and just increased the # of bars in my subscription. Can't wait to try them all!

I got this soap as a "Squatch Pick" for my very first order. I love the scent. It's not overpoweringly cedar so you don't smell like a hamster cage, but it's present and melds nicely with the citrus. The mint was detected mostly when I used this bar soap as a shampoo. I could feel the tingling sensation on my scalp. Mild to moderate scent intensity which is actually a good thing for a nice, every day scent. Definitely a manlier and more adult scent than store bought mass produced soap and my skin is left feeling incredible and thoroughly clean. I can't wait to try all the other kinds of soaps as well!

review_title: I really want to like it
review_content: I bought The pine Tar soap and had high expectations. But unfortunately for the price the soap does not last very long, just about a week at 2 showers a day and that's removing the bar from the shower after each use and storing it in a container. I can't speak on behalf of any of their other soaps as I have not tried them but the pine tar did have a rejuvenating feel after use and smelled great. But for the money In good conscience I just can't recommend the product.
Exfoliates and smells great. Only complaint is the black might stain your shower if you aren't careful. Not a problem if you rinse it off.

Second scent I've tried so far and love it! After a few uses I'd definitely say I prefer the pine tar more. But that doesn't mean the bay rum is anything short of amazing; it also has an extremely addictive scent, while working hard to give you the best clean, while leaving your skin healthy and smooth when the shower is done. Two squatchy thumbs up!
America
This scent is awesome, and definitely goes head-to-head with the Gold Moss. I'd definitely say it's one of the best offerings by Dr. Squatch.

review_title: First bar of Pine Tar and there will be more.
review_content: Lathers great and makes your skin feel great. LONG LASTING sent as well. I'm hooked. Great product.

Very disappointed in my $15 block of wood. My soap sticks to it worse than just leaving it on my wire shower caddy. A waste of $15 that got by me being in my shopping cart when I started my subscription. Love the soap though but this thing may become kindling.

This bar has a nice scent with a very minimal scrubbing to it. The salt is a nice addition to it as a subtle scrub bar. Soap has a nice scent that isn't very strong. Overall good moss is an ok bar but not there best.

This bar has the most aggressive exfoliation additives to it and is one of my go to bars for when I travel. Lasts a long time and will clean you up no matter how smelly or dirty you are. Pine tar also gives you the cleanest feel and has a very strong pine scent which isn't over powering or not welcomed. It's scent backs up what it does. Cleanest feel and scent from this for sure. Awesome soap!

Didn't like this soap at all. Scent is very weak. I couldnt get the cypress scent or sage from the bar as advertised. It's very subtle and to me was way too subtle to where I didn't enjoy it. Did well cleaning and not drying out skin.

Awesome scent! It's not that normal alcohol scent like you expect from bay rum. It's very well balanced with its spicy notes from the cinnamon and the orange zest. The pine gives it that twist that makes it really manly scented. Very smooth bar that lathers up well with a loofa or wash cloth. This bar has a scent that also lingers on you after your done using it the longest. Great bar for sure!

been using this for just over a week now...love the smell very vibrant. Wife likes this one the most so far
I do wish the smell lingered after the shower....I guess it rinses to clean to leave any scent behind....

review_title: I'm a girl and I love this stuff... Plus almost nothing else helps my psoriasis!
review_content: I am a female with extremely dry, sensitive skin, and recently had a pretty bad bout of psoriasis. I typically avoid things such as bar soaps or anything with exfoliating qualities, and opt for more soothing, gentler cleansers. I was lucky enough to work with the Dr. Squatch team on a project and they were kind enough to send a bar of the Pine Tar soap home with me. I must have been feeling particularly adventurous that evening, and gave the somewhat masculine scented, exfoliating, bar soap a try in the shower- and boy oh boy, my skin thanked me. The natural exfoliation helped eliminate a lot of the dryness from my psoriasis and the natural qualities of the soap had an immediate soothing effect. After a few days of using this product, I could see a noticeable improvement in the appearance and feel of my psoriasis, and my skin felt softer and healthier overall. I've spent thousands of dollars looking for prescription and natural products that would give even the slightest improvement to my psoriasis, and this is one of the best I've found yet! HUGE FAN of both this soap, and the Dr. Squatch guys! Thanks again!!!

I just bought the Cedar citrus and the Eucalyptus Greek Yogurt this week. Both are great smelling and leave your skin feeling awesome and smelling good at the same time. I will definitely be a return customer!!

This brush is very nice! For a synthetic style brush I really like this. The body of the bristles have a nice tight feel to it and the ends of the bristles are VERY soft. The ends really work up a lather and the body of the bristles doesn't lose its shape or get knotted up. It stays firm, maintains its shape, and gets a lather built up very quickly. Highly recommended!
This is a very good product !

Deep Sea Goats milk is a really nice soap that is well balanced in regards to moisturization and exfoliation for my skin. The soap lathers extremely thick and creamy as it feels like your literally putting milk on your skin. Its a very smooth soap application that rinses off very easily which in turn leaves my skin very clean feeling with no dryness at all. This soap is very good for anyone starting to grow a thick beard as the goat milk will help keep the itch and dryness away! Its also very good if you have dry skin or you want a soap bar to wash your hair without drying it out or needing a conditioner for it. 

I also like the oatmeal they put in there as it has a nice gentle scrub to it. If you have water that has "hard" properties to it then this soap will help your skin feel right after you take a shower! The only thing I didn't like about this soap (and its not a deal breaker) is the scent. Smells VERY floral with a hint of woodsy scent to it (not sure exactly what it is for the woodsy fragrance). The scent reminds me of clean linens for some reason. The scent in my opinion is more feminine and the woodsy additions make the soap lean a bit more towards the manly side. Overall if your looking for a soap for your lady or you want a moisturizing soap that gives you that clean smooth feel then this soap will do the trick!

review_title: Third selection and not a bad bar in the bunch
review_content: Just started on my final bar of my first subscription order - the Spearmint Basil. This is another good body bar - no need for a cloth or loofa, just use the soap. Like the Cedar Citrus, it's a great lather producer but I think the lather is more rich with this bar - it's more creamy than it is foamy. That combined with the great Spearmint scent makes for an invigorating morning shower. Can't wait to try three more in my next shipment.

review_title: Bar Number Two, Also Great but Different
review_content: Just started on this bar, the second in my subscription (the first was Pine Tar, which I really liked). This one is nice too. It also has a great scent and make my skin feel great. As winter has started I've really appreciated the way these soaps don't dry my skin. This bar is a real lather producer, much more so than the Pine Tar. It's also a nice body bar, meaning you can use just the bar to bathe with, no need to lather up a loofa or cloth. I couldn't really do that with the Pine Tar because of the strong exfoliation elements it has. That may be the best selling point for this one.

Just got my first subscription order and tried the Pine Tar bar first. I love the smell of this soap and the way it makes my skin feel. However, take them seriously when they say it's exfoliating, it will take your skin off if you're not careful where and how vigorously you use it! Will order more of this one going forward though, its good stuff. Looking forward to trying the other scents.

I just ordered the Gold Moss and Deep Sea Goat's Milk as stocking stuffers for the boyfriend. He's used Dr. Squatch soap before and loved it. These smell amazing, I can't wait for him to try them out. (If he doesn't like them, I'll keep them for myself)

I've used four of the scents and so far this one is by far my favorite. It leaves my bathroom smelling fresh and minty. Cleans and lathers well and leaves the skin feeling smooth. I am a soapscriber and I get two bars per month. I will continue getting this one on a monthly basis. Excellent product!

Cedar Citrus us very refreshing. Of the four bars that I have sampled, this has the most unique scent. It leaves my skin feeling and smelling clean and smooth. This is one of only two varieties they carry in our local stores and I can see why it's so popular. Great lather without leaving residue like the Pine Tar.

I am working my way through all of the Squatch scents, one bar at a time. I began using the Bay Rum yesterday and I was expecting Old Spice from what other reviewers were saying. I opened it up and used this and thought it was very pleasant. I think Old Spice is much stronger. This was a nice mix of spice, cedar and pine (and all three are present when you smell it). It is similar to the other soaps in that it cleans well and leaves my skin feeling soft. I am not an old man and this didn't make me feel or smell like an old man after using it. I didn't get any complaints from the ladies either. I think this is a keeper and will likely become a regular in my soapscription.

I don't know why Nautical Sage is getting poor reviews because I think this one has a great scent. I can definitely detect the sage and the lavender. They come together to make a lovely scent which isn't too overpowering but also isn't girly. This was the 8th of the nine bars in the line that I've tried. I'd say it's middle of the pack, but the lather is fabulous and I feel really nice and clean and fresh and manly and super and wonderful. Next Up: Eucalyptus Greek Yogurt

review_title: Not as girly as I expected it to be
review_content: When I first smelled this in the box I wasn't sure I was going to like it. It smelled a little too "perfume-y" for my liking. After breaking it out and using it, I really do like it. The smell is actually not bad and it cleans really well. This bar lasted longer than the Pine Tar and about as long as the Citrus Cedar. Nice, refreshing feeling after using it and it has great lather. I like it.

First off I want to say if there is a negative review about a products smell that has nothing to do with the quality of the soap...that's personal choice....now on to the goats milk soap... I have tried a few other bars but by far this is my favorite lathers up well so u don't have to use as much plus it makes my beard very soft...the others I tried were great but kinda didn't hit home what I was looking for in a beard wash as well as body...this is one ...i'll be buying this again...also the customer service is second to none here...just ask they will try to help u...well hpe this helps someone decide on a soap
I want to say this the best smelling soap my wife likes the pine tar I love spearmint and basil love the bay rum super soap
Yes yes yes the smell is amazing, feels great on my skin, this is 1 I will not stop buying for sure
Feels great, not to powerful of a smell, But it does smell nice, and it's great for the skin
Turns your weak gross human skin into thick smooth Yeti armor. 10/10 would bath again

review_title: Excellent woodsy scent; natural but not overpowering
review_content: I enjoy wearing this scent very much. Used to swear by Drakkar; but I'm finding Hemlock Trail accents my Pine Tar soap wonderfully. It has a very earthy and masculine scent; Pine and Cedar are really prominent. It's not overpowering; and smells very genuine; like a summer day deep in the woods.
I am almost done with my second bar of Dr. Squatch soap, and my skin has never felt better. I absolutely love this soap. i recommend it to all my friends!

review_title: I guess that's why we have options!!!
review_content: I really like nautical sage. I've now tried all the soaps and it's probably my third favorite (tied with pine tar) behind Goat's Milk and Gold Moss. It probably lathers the best of all the varieties. I get 2 of each on my subscription.

I spend a lot of time in the woods; hiking, camping, hunting and scouting. Most of the time I try to "de-scent" so as not to scare off my querry. This soap smells so natural and so much like the woods near where I live and play, I can start my trip feeling clean. I work in the foodservice industry and in a fast paced kitchen it is hard to stay smelling clean. At the end of being hot and sweaty and being splashed with hot grease and dirty dishwater I still smell manly and clean. Many of my female co-workers have commented on how good it smells. Gold Moss has it going on, and Dr. Squatch is freekin' awesome! It's about time someone takes the "art of manliness" seriously. I smell great and not like some teenage kid who smells like a flower bed. This is some great stuff. Gold Moss is definitely a keeper.

I recently purchased the sampler bundle and have begun using this soap. It smells good and lathers up nicely. It keeps me clean and my skin smooth. This is not my favorite in the sampler bundle, but it is a good soap.

I really like this soap. It has a great smell and leaves me feeling clean. Since I started using this soap my skin is smoother and the dry rough spots on my elbows have disappeared. I have no need for lotions or anything like that anymore.

Yes, the soap sticks to the soap saver. But, it can be easily removed by pushing the soap from one side, and it will pop right off. I've also found that rinsing the soap saver before you put your soap back helps keep it free of residue build up. I really it!
My skin feels great and I feel clean, I get up at 0400 HRS for work and the smells alone help me wake up in a better mood.

I have tried and enjoyed many of the Squatch scents, but the spearmint basil is definitely a big winner! So glad that I decided to give it a try, I am still a big gold moss fan but this is definitely a great scent to put in the rotation.

I ordered the 3 bar sample pack with the soap saver. The first bar is still going strong after a week and a half. The soap saver does allow the bar to dry after each shower, it does stick but I haven't found it to be keeping any soap behind yet. I was concerned about the average bar life and this is better than the average I've read about here. Looking at subscribing when I get low. Great products for someone who can't handle the mass produced soaps found at the stores.

review_title: Addicted to the way this smells!
review_content: The abrasive feel of this soap was a little strong at first but I love the way it removes any dirt, grease, or dead skin from sun exposure. After a few days of using it, I'm addicted. I can't describe the smell... it's like sticking your nose inside a pine tree, but with a slight soapy clean smell too. This is the first bar Ive pulled out of my box containing 5 more soaps. I hope I like them all this much!

Bottom line up front - order a second bar! I felt the same way the negative reviewers did the first time I got this scent. It smelled like nothing and I was very disappointed. I think, perhaps, there was a bad batch in which they forgot to add some key ingredients. However, I forgot to update my scent preference on my subscription the next month and got another bar. This one was WAY different. The scent was exactly what I had been hoping for the first time. Strong sage notes and very refreshing. It's one of my favorites now. Give it a second chance!

Arrived yesterday so I took a second shower. Besides the manly smell, I could tell how clean i felt. Then it rinses away without any of the usual "can't get it off" feeling. Best part today it has my whole bathroom smelling great.
Gold Moss and Aloe are my two favorites. I will never go back to commercial soap again. My skin thanks me.
This is a good bar of soap that lathers well, moisturizes well, and smells pleasant. It's not a strong smell and doesn't linger beyond the shower.

review_title: Amazing Scent and by far My Favorite!
review_content: The scent of this soap is perfect and leads to a fantastic showering experience. My wife loves this soap as well, not because she uses it, but because our bathroom now smells like Bay Rum. It's not an overpowering scent but it does stay with you which I love. It's a classy smell and not a cheap, Axe type of smell. You will not be disappointed with this bar of soap.

I've been a fan of specialty soaps for about a year now, and a believer in Sasquatch for most of my life (we have hair and blood DNA, afterall). I saw Dr. Squatch pop up on my Facebook page numerous times, and on about the 100th time, I decided to look at the web site. I became a "6-Bar a-Quarter" Soapscriber, to save money. The last soap I chose for my soapscription this quarter was the Deep Sea Goats Milk. And, wouldn't you know it, it was the one my girlfriend think smelled the best, saying, "It smells like how a man is supposed to smell." I actually blindfolded her and did a scent type playoffs with the soaps, with the playoff brackets included, and the Goats Mike won. In my opinion, I like the smell of all 6 I received this time. They're all unique. I've used this bar about 2-1/2 weeks now, and it should be gone by the end of this week. I read on the site that you can even use the Goats Milk soap to wash your hair and beard, so that's exactly what I did. My hair came out really clean and my beard ca
Was skeptical about $7 bar soap. In a week it has exceeded my expectations and is the best stuff I've used. Tip of the cap to Dr Squatch.

Got these for my husband last Christmas and loved them so much we do the monthly subscription. He smells so good! I actually even prefer these soaps and use them as well! They have now become a must have at our house!
Been using this soap for about a week now, and love it! Will definitely be buying more in the future!
Smells good and feel incredible. It leaves my skin feeling smooth and moisturized. My wife will actually touch my feet after showering with this soap.
Love the way my skin felt afterwards but the smell is not my favorite, and that's probably a matter of preference more than anything.
Breaks up the oil well and doesn't irritate eczema. Leaves me clean and comfortable.

review_title: It works, just needs some love
review_content: Mine worked as advertised, but as others have said the soap sticks to it *very* well. I've used it as a "scrub" to get at my callouses...maybe a future upgrade would feature a puck of pumice on the underside? To keep your soap from sticking, treat a new one of these with a coat of melted beeswax. It brings out the woodgrain, protects the wood further, and your soap will stay put but not stick to it.

review_title: My only soap from here on.
review_content: Smells clean and manly, not sweet and perfumey like the other soaps that teenagers use. Gives a great clean and rinses easily. Really like the Pine Tar Bar!
So far this is my favorite soap!! I use this on my beard and can enjoy the wonderful scent all day long. Not to strong but not weak like some girly soap.
And my skin is happy! This is the best soap I have ever come across that doesn't hurt my eco-system and actually enhances my natural scent! Can't wait to try the cologne samples I just got!
bay rum soap. strong fragrant oil. calm wet ablution

The soap saver really does help the bar last longer. My bay rum and pine tar lasted nearly the full two weeks. Beforehand my soap bars were lasting, maybe a week, if that. I'm really surprised by the negative reviews.
It smells great. It feels great. It is great. I highly recommend getting soap from Dr. Squatch.
This t-shirt is super soft and cool. It has a unique design with an awesome color. It feels really nice and there is no tag!

Just imagine yourself laying down in a forest and you don't want to get up because it smells nice. Then this tree moss starts growing on your body but you let it stay because its scent is superb. This is basically what gold moss scrub is like.
Smells great, and does not leave my skin dried out like other soaps. Bay Rum is a good one!
This bar has a yummy scent, I almost want to eat it. I just wish it would lather a little more.
This is my everyday soap. It's great for dry skin and has a great smell. It's also my gf favorite, so it's a must.

My soap saver showed up and looks amazing, good quality craftsmanship and the Dr. Squatch logo WAS branded on it. Ignore the negative comments and give this product a fair assessment. Did I mention their soap is awesome!!!

...and I love this manly soap. For me! Not my husband/boyfriend/other! The scent is addicting...I find myself lathering up more times than required because I just adore the smell and feel of this soap. It's luxurious to me...AND hardworking. I just glow when I leave the shower! I have used Grandpa's Pine Tar Soap quite often in the past, and if you're accustomed to that scent this one is much subtler...and more complex. Buy. Love. And spread the word!

This soap is pretty fantastic. Smells great (nice pine smell but not one of those fake chemically pine but a real forest pine smell), lathers well, has some good texture due to the sand and oatmeal, leaves your skin feeling clean (doesn't leave that soap film feeling to your skin). However it is a dark soap and if you care about your white wash cloth you may want to think about getting a darker cloth (only down side I've seen).

review_title: I like it... I like it a laawt.
review_content: The title says it for me. This soap smells like the great outdoors and it's definitely manly. The sand and oatmeal in this bar will ensure that no chigger, tick, or small forest creature will hitch a ride on your man-hide. And the scent? The scent is strong enough for a sasquatch, but made for a man... This pine scent will have the most horrendous battle-a$$ gone in 60 seconds. The lather is just right... There's just enough lather to let you know that it is soap and not some weird square hockey puck. If you tweeze your eyebrows, you probably won't like this soap. My only disappointment is that I didn't find it sooner.

review_title: One of my favorites; pleasant Sage comes strongly
review_content: Clearly scent is evaluated subjectively, but I find Nautical Sage to be very fresh and find the seaside vibe to be fitting. Additionally, this bar is scented strictly with essential oils and no fragrance oils which is another major plus. I cannot understand the current rating, and hope that over time it will increase. When I first tried it I was not sold immediately, yet it has grown on me and now we keep this one by the kitchen sink. It works perfectly there. Clary sage and lavender go very well together; this reminds me of Schmidt's natural deodorant scent Lavender and Sage with a more masculine aroma. I don't smell the cypress too strongly, but I know its in there. Sea salt is always great and contributes to making hands feel more nourished, hence why we like having it near the sink to offset harsh dish "soaps." As a reference my other two favorites from Dr. Squatch are Pine Tar and Gold Moss Scrub, lately Cedar Citrus has also grown on me. Also if you have not tried the natural beard oil/cologne

Just got this on the mail today and OMG! Bought a variety pack and opened this one first. Immediately blown away by the classic rugged smell. After a shower and shave with a nice organic sandlewood soap, I smell like an outdoorsy millionaire. Thank you Dr. Squatch! I'm now a devoted fan. Nate in SA

I'm a rookie with this soap and a lifelong consumer of Supermarket soaps, being a stubborn customer that only used brand name soaps and shampoos, I was a little leary. I received my first two bars of Pine tar about a month ago and when I lathered up, it was WONDERFUL! The smell put my mind to the deep forests immediately and the added black lather makes you really feel like a Squatch.

My friends and I refer to this one informally as the "Pine Tar Nipple Eraser" as they aren't lying when they said it has serious exfoliation qualities. Made with sand and oatmeal flakes, this is a scrubbing bar that smells good, scrubs well, and leaves you with a clean feeling, but you should definitely mind around your softer bits as you can scratch yourself with the bar. I recommend wearing one side down on your hand before using it as a body bar. Also given its color and sand component, it's also the most likely to leave a ring in your bathtub. Not a deal breaker for me, but may be for some.

review_title: This is my third favorite bar
review_content: Behind Gold Moss Scrub and Pine Tar, this is in my regular rotation. I like the scent (to me, it's heavy on cloves), it lathers up well, and is a nice contrast to the other bars I regularly use to give my skin a break from exfoliation for a couple weeks (which is about how long the bars last for me).

My husband was really into the Armani and Lacoste colognes when we first met. Admittedly, they smelled great on him. But in the last few years, I've really been getting into replacing our chemical-filled products with healthy alternatives. I was able to change his shampoo and conditioner, his soap, shaving gel and deodorant, but it was hard for him to part with his cologne. Luckily, I found Dr. Squatch and ordered the samples. He really liked both scents, but he picked Driftwood, so I ordered him a full-sized bottle just now. Thanks for making great-smelling cologne. Now how about women's fragrances?

This has become my only soap I will use. I absolutely love the smell of the Pine Tar soap. The other scents are great too. I just keep reordering the Pine Tar as it is my favorite. It is gritty and rough, but I really like that I feel like I can really get clean with it. Usually a bar lasts me about 4 weeks just by keeping it dry in between showers. Keep up the great work Dr. Squatch!
If you haven't tried cool fresh Aloe yet, you are wrong! Great smelling bar of soap!
This was my first squatch soap experience! Awesome product! I use it in conjunction with a luffa. I plan o trying all of the soaps available. My skin feels much better now that I am chemical free!
Another awesome Soap! It smells great! My skin feels awesome and it leaves my bathroom smelling great too!

review_title: I no longer smell like a goat
review_content: This is one of only a few scents that I have found in any store around here and it was over two hours away. It was one of the first I tried. The goat's milk makes my skin really soft and this soap has a fresh, clean scent. They key to thisvsoap awesomeness is how well it moisturizes. I have dry skin to begin with so the more moisture the better. Also, this bar seemed to be the longest-lasting with the citrus Cedar a close second. I'm happy to get 2 weeks out of my bar and this one lasted three. Great product for sure!

Just started using this stuff a couple months ago but have no complaints. Smells great, lasts for hours. Also love the Evergreen trail cologne. I've never worn cologne but I love this stuff. Always get compliments on how good I smell.

Pine Tar..... I am going outside as soon as the sun goes down to communicate by banging on a tree and howling to my brethren to buy this soap.It's almost spring time to attract the ladies!!!!!!!.... J. Squatch (aka Stink Foot)
I have forgotten the pleasure of taking showers until now.Try it you'll see what I meanðŸ˜ƒ.... Stink FootðŸ˜

review_title: Aloe is my favorite so far
review_content: Only tried the pine tar other than the cool fresh aloe but I like the aloe more. The best way to make you soap last is to use a wash cloth to get the lather then rinse off the bar and keep it in a soap container. Definitely a customer for life

Pine Tar soap is great. It smells amazing (while you're showering) and I use it as a shampoo, face wash, and body soap. At first I was scared the first time I showered with it because I got that squeaky clean feeling but don't mistake that with dryness. Once you dry off you realize how soft this makes your skin. It also smells amazing. I have short hair so Im able to use it as a shampoo as well but Idk how well any bar soap would be for long hair. Can't wait to try the aloe soap once I run out of the pine tar!

The soap lathers like crazy and leaves you feeling clean and refreshed. I use it mostly on my beard and it is always soft and clean after using the soap. The scent is nice. I found it almost comforting and it reminded me of my grandfathers spice closet that i used to love as a kid. Really great especially just before bed.
Don't understand the negative reviews??? It has a very pleasant scent and lathers good! I feel clean and refreshed after showering with this soap. This and Bay Rum are at the top of my list!

I work between 40 and 60 hours per week on an automotive assembly line. I come home stinking and with dirt in places I can explain. Dr Squatch Pine Tar soap gets the crud and stench off like nothing I've ever used before. It also has a scent my wife and kids all like and I love. Thanks for the little square miracle. Aryk Sandridge

This is my second bar of Dr. Squatch Soap the first being Pine Tar they are totally different from each other. They are described perfectly the Nautical Sage is a zesty fresh soap that awakens all senses more of a going out for the evening soap. While the Pine Tar is a bold rock your face off tear solid steel beams apart with your teeth apart. I am starting to see you can't go wrong with anything Dr. Squatch makes. My girlfriend loves the way I smell as she is the one who keeps buying them we are going to try all nine!!

review_title: Hands down the best soap ever!!!
review_content: Thank you DR.SQUATCH for making a real soap for a real man and my girlfriend loves the Pine Tar sent! It lavers up great in the shower and gives me that all over clean feeling. Despite the other reviews my Pine Tar has lasted going on two weeks thank you DR.SQUATCH I will never switch back!

review_title: I smell like a champ, but not like a sweaty, smelly one...
review_content: Gold moss soap is epic. I leave the shower a champion, like a 26 miler, like I just pulled off a hat trick. That's what champs do, they execute beyond their victory: and then they bathe. And they bathe to smell like a champion, not a defeated no-account non-winner (loser). I'm a champ, and now I smell like one. I'm leaving my desk now to go home and shower with Gold Moss and re-establish my champ status. Each day is a victory when you act like a champ, and a greater victory when you smell like one. Carry on.

"Holy @#$*" she exclaimed, overwhelmed by the sweeping aroma of a pine forest through our apartment. Yes, this soap isn't your standard pump of mysteriously scented gel. This soap hits like a Tyson uppercut to your pores. It then proceeds to jab its way through the rest of the odors in your bathroom, followed by the rest of your domicile. Work in a fish market and bring that scent home with you? Not anymore. If you want to scrub any scent off your body and stimulate your olfactory senses like a fresh baked loaf of sourdough bread, look no further. (The only negative to this soap is how short it lasts because you'll want to bathe in its glory so often.)
Definitely one of my favorite scented soaps. Will be keep buying this one on a regular basis.

Out of their options, this scent isn't the best they offer. It reminded me too much of an old man and not of a 'bay' or 'harbor'. I'll stick to Nautical Sage for that. I'm 24 and my night life game is strong. I don't need to be smelling like an old man. It's not a 'bad' scent, just not the best in my opinion. However, the soap itself does wonders on my skin and makes me soft. For that, I'll keep using this bar until it's all gone.

review_title: Grab a towel and some sun screen. This will take you to paradise!
review_content: I'm not entirely sure why this soap is getting bad reviews. I received mine and I'm loving it. It is very nautical and crisp smelling. I'm always at the beach and this is perfect. Good lather and gentle on my skin. Scent stays with me as well for about an hour or so after showering. I'll definitely keep buying Nautical Sage.

Got this bar in the mail yesterday and immediately jumped in the shower to lather up. I have a big beard and the natural ingredients made me feel safe that I wouldn't be stripping away any natural oils. It left my skin soft and smelling great as well. I will be buying more scents and bars to try in the future

Best soap I have ever used! Waited with baited breath for it to arrive in the mail. Got it today and tried it. The aroma was so great when I opened the package, I had to shower right away to give a try. It exfoliated, moisturized, and made my skin feel great. Was a wonderful experience! My fiance even hung out in the bathroom to smell it while I was showering. Then she attacked me after I got out!

review_title: i just love this soap and the beard oil
review_content: Gotta admit i am partial to the pine tar soap and hemlock trail beard oil but i love these products, i get excited each time i see a new product coming down the line, can't wait for deodorant and shampoo to come out....keep on squatchin....
I'm a former soldier and current biker in Los Angeles I would highly recommend these soaps. I am glad I stumbled upon this company you have a customer for life.
Great lather, smells amazing, makes my skin feel great
The best soap. No more needs to be said. Great gift for smelly friends. Got myself one too cuz I wanted a Squatch box for stashing.....stuff.

I found Dr Squatch thru the Bearded Bastard & I've been a customer since. Squatch soap has become the standard by which all other soaps are judged. Showers are like a beautiful dream. Thank you for waking me up from a body wash nightmare.

review_title: Great, but not the best for $7.00
review_content: This soap was great; it smelled great, cleaned great, and I felt great after using it. However, it only lasted a week. I have a soap dish in my shower that I put it on, obviously, when I am not using it. I guess you're supposed to let it dry out? I'm not going to consistently use expensive soap that I need to dry out after every shower. But again, this soap was great quality and maybe I just got a bad bar.
My soap saver came without the "Dr Squatch" branding

This is a nice aftershave I like to use! Sometimes I will use it at night as a beard oil as well. It really helps moisturize your beard especially when your trying to grow it out. The scent is a bit woodsy (which I don't care for too much) but no where near as strong as Hemlock trail. If your looking for a cleaner/lighter version then this is the way to go. I would wear this during the daytime and the hemlock at night as the hemlock scent is better to have around the house when you winding down or trying to impress the lady haha! 

This cologne has more of a citrus hint to it so for daytime use its a win. Great oil that lasts a long time. Thank you Squatch Nation! #Squatchaddict

review_title: I feel like I'm using actual soap for the first time in my life.
review_content:
A truly wonderful product. I hope Dr. Squatch continues to grow without compromising this soap because it is a game-changer for me. I've always suffered from acne concentrated solely on my chest. Rarely on the face or back, but my chest would always break out no matter what I did. Well I've used the Pine Tar soap bar for 9 days. I don't have any new blemishes, and the ones I had are all slowly becoming smaller, less red, and less irritated. A couple are completely gone.

The soap itself is a pleasure to use. The oatmeal feels like you're getting a massage. The scent is fantastic. I admittedly love a powerful sent, and this one delivers. As others have said, if you leave the bar in your bathroom, the whole room will take on a lasting scent of pine. I've never struggled with dry skin so there wasn't much to improve on here, but I do feel very clean and smooth after using it. 

I did not notice a black film forming on the shower like others have said. Typical soaps that aren't plain white always left a little something, and this went down the drain just like those did.

The bar only last 9 washes for me, but it's important to note that it was my first time ever using it, so for many of these showers I continued to lather up out of pleasure, not necessity. I'm sure once the novelty of the soap wears off, I'll be using it more economically, and I would assume 2 weeks + is very achievable. 

Gold Moss is up next. Thank you for this product. It's invigorating my day every time I use it. I am a natural skeptic, and generally speaking, I tend to poo-poo people who gravitate towards all-natural/organic/vegan products (though using products that don't come from Palm Oil is very, very important to me). I'm not a fan of "pseudo-sciences" for lack of a better term. I often feel that if something was truly bad for you, in this age, the information would be out there. But in this case I don't feel my typical thinking applies. It just seems logical to me. Why not use a product that harnesses glycerin instead of replacing it with chemicals? Why not use a product that smells better? Why not use a product that feels better?

The easing of chest acne may be a coincidence. It's come and gone before. I'll know more about that in a month or so because I won't be using anything else (though the signs as of now are promising). The rest I already know. This is the best soap I've ever used.

Spearmint basil soap is an alright soap. I like how it has a really powerful minty scent to it but it reminds of me washing my body with toothpaste. The lather is thick and the soap itself on my skin feels very good. I like to use the soap especially in the morning when I'm waking up as the scent is very refreshing. I didn't get any scent of basil in mine so I'm not sure if I got a bad bar or batch. Overall...soap does its trick but not something I really enjoyed compared to other soap bars. In short...it lathers good, its very refreshing, leaves a great scent in my bathroom, and it cleans me up real nice.

review_title: A very unique fragrance I think most men will enjoy.
review_content:
I'm giving this cologne 5 stars, though I think 4.5 would be more appropriate. Let me start by saying, like Dr. Squatch's soaps, you are in for a very unique experience with Hemlock Trail. As clearly stated, there is only 1 oz of cologne for $42 dollars. That translates to a whopping $143 dollars if you were to average it out to your standard 3.4oz bottle of cologne. That is very, very pricey, gentlemen. I support paying for quality, but it'd be great if we can get that price point down by about 25%. Hopefully that's in the cards as Dr. Squatch continues to grow.

Having said all this, the design of the bottle is FANTASTIC. Aesthetically, it just looks awesome on your shelf. Rugged and old school, and inspires confidence after applying it (which is 1/2 the battle with any cologne!). Additionally, I won't pretend to know the actual engineering here, but there is a some sort of stopper mechanism, so when you are adding a drop to your fingers, you'd have to actually continue dabbing over and over in order to use an excessive amount. With other colognes a couple spritzes can be quite a lot, and then other bottles don't have any kind've stopper on top. But this cologne inspires you to use in moderation, and that will certainly extend the life of the bottle.

Now to the scent... it is wonderful. When taking a whiff directly from the bottle, for me, it came off a little too much like they just extracted pine straight from a Christmas tree and dumped it into the bottle. I started to wonder if this was the right product for me. But fear not! When applying moderate dabs to your pulse points and beard, it really does take on a different, more subtle (yet certainly pronounced and unique) scent that absolutely delivers. The strong Christmasy scent in the bottle somehow begins to embody the earthy and all-natural musk I think most people will be looking for with this product. To be fair, I think part of my initial... skepticism... is that the scent is so interesting and unlike anything you can get in a department store that I almost didn't quite know how to react.

Bottom line... my girlfriend who rarely is a fan of my choices in this department loved the scent. The best way I can describe it, as mentioned earlier, is subtle but pronounced. It has an impact without taking over the room. It also comes off differently at different times for me. I'll smell my pulse point and it'll smell woodsy, and then 10 minutes later if I do it again, and that citrus will make an appearance. That's really cool.

Pros: Unique, enjoyable scent in a wonderful bottle design.
Cons: Pricey, and a bit of an acquired taste for those used to more typical colognes. But that taste will certainly be acquired.

Bottom line: I absolutely recommend it. There is room for improvement with the price, and maybe (emphasis on maybe) there's something that can be done to appease people who don't want to deviate too far from typical scents... but I wouldn't go there. I love it as is! Driftwood is up next.

This bag was sent to me during the testing phase, because I requested a case of some kind that allows me to go to the gym and keep my Squatch soap safe in my bathroom bag to shower afterward.

This travel bag gets the job done and is surprisingly durable.

Outstanding creamy-rich lather and masculine scents combine to give you the ultimate multipurpose bar soap experience! From head shaving to beard washing, these bar soaps provide superior results! DR.SQUATCH wears the Crown!

If by "saver" you mean, "I'll save pieces from the bar once you pry it off with a crowbar," then I'll give it to you - it saves soap! But, if you mean that it saves your soap for the next time you use it, then I have some issues - every single time I've try to take the bar off the "soap saver," I have to literally pry it off, and always lose pieces of soap in the process. Since the bars cost what they do, I'm losing valuable soap every single time. I'm incredibly disappointed.
I had major dry skin issues after 4 days of useing this my skin is already clearing up fantastic. The smell is amazing too don't let the color turn you off this stuff is amazing.

I work in a grease manufacturing facility. On a daily basis I can get oil, grease, solvents, additives, or solids (graphite, etc..) on my skin. Typically I have to scrub very hard or use dawn dish soap or do both. Scrubbing leads to dry skin and dawn leads to me smelling like dish soap. Now I just use pine tar and don't need to scrub my skin off or use lotion. Not sure if there is a natural degreaser in the soap but it sure feels like it.
Never thought I'd someone who loves soap. But, this is some dope soap.

I got this and two other scents earlier in the month and I could not be happier with them. If I had to criticize anything it would be that I go through them fairly quick. Love the smell of this one, it fills my bathroom with a nice aroma. The soaps are great on my skin. I have gotten comments on how much better my skin looks.
I love the smell of this soap. Cedar smells so good to me and this soap rocks. If you like the smell of cedar add this one to your cart.
Broke this one out this morning. Awesome exfoliate. Good smell. I started rotating this one in a few times a week. Does a great job. Awesome product.
This stuff works! Stumbled upon from a friend- can't not have!
Spearmint Basil will have you feeling smooth and fresh. The smell is great and it's definitely fun to shower with Squatch Soap. In my opinion this is the second best soap after Bay Rum.

I love this bay rum soap. It's a fantastic scent that leaves you feeling clean enough to make an entire galley walk the plank. I got quite a few soaps with my soapscription and can say this is the best one.

Just started using this one for the first time. It's a lather beast. Great as a beard wash too. It has a less noticeable scent than most of the other bars so if you're looking for low-key in that department this is one to try.

review_title: First impressions on the travel bag
review_content: This arrived today. I will be trying it out with a wet bar before I commit to using this on a trip. First, it's a good size. Bar fits fine in the bag. Not too big, not too small. Side seams look sturdy. Next, the drawstrings are a concern. They are essentially very thin twine. I have visions of those breaking in short order, particularly if I or someone else tries to tighten/over-tighten the bag opening. Shouldn't be difficult to replace if they do break, but why not settle for something more durable to begin with, ideally with some sort of slider to keep the strings taut. Thirdly, I have concerns about the absorption qualities. I would feel better if they had doubled up on the material, but right now, it's essentially one layer of canvas, with a loose weave (while you can't see through it, light passes through it with zero problem). Got a bar damp and put it in the bag. Several minutes later, while the bag itself does not appear to be wet, you can feel a very slight dampness through the material. So not quite waterproof as I had hoped, but I'll give it a whirl.

I just took my first shower with this bar soap, and it was so good that I had to come and talk about it right away. The texture was nice, scent was nice, feel very clean and not dried out after. Buy it, you won't regret it.

I got a bar of this in a Bespoke Post box a couple months ago, and it was game-changing. It smells like the most attractive, manly forest floor you've ever seen in your life. I've been showering daily with it for two months, and it's finally almost gone. I can't fathom how some people are only getting 1-3 weeks out of a bar of soap?

This was the soap that made me get a Dr. Squatch subscription. It's phenomenal.

I got a bar of Dr. Squatch as a part of a Bespoke Post gift box, and I LOVE it!!! Cleans great, smells great, and leaves my skin feeling super soft, not dried out like all those harsh body washes. Just ordered myself the 4 bar gift box, and can't wait to try all the different scents! This is the perfect soap for all us Manly Men, and Squatchly Squatches!!! :joy:

review_title: Bay Rum is my favorite bar by far!
review_content: This bar smells awesome! My lady cant keep her hands off me when I get out of the shower! This is a good thing. Thanks Dr. Squatch!

Out of their nine scents, I'm surprised this one isn't more popular... While using it, I smell the sage along with a sea saltiness, resulting in the scent of an ocean breeze, but even better! 

If you're already a squatcher and considering the nautical sage bar, don't hesitate! In my opinion, it holds up with the top selling scents! 

If you're new to the sport of squatching, you better start working on trying all nine scents. So far I've tried 4/9, all which have been nothing short of superb!

Just received the Shampoo and Conditioner and had my first showering experience with them. Right off the bat both products smell terrific! Just the right amount of manly scent you would expect from Dr. Squatch! Using the recommended nickel sized amount I lathered up with the shampoo. Due to the all natural ingredients you won't be getting a massive lather worked up like you would get with commercial shampoos. No worries though, because that nickel sized amount got my hair the cleanest I've felt it in along time! I followed up with the conditioner next. Using the same amount I applied and let it sit for a few minutes. WOW! The fresh tingle I got felt like no other. You can feel this cooling yet moisturizing sensation invigorate your scalp! It left my hair very manageable and fresh. Dr Squatch has a real winner here! ( Please come up with a deodorant next!)
You can't go wrong with this stuff. I will be buying this and the conditioner from now on. Good job guys.
I am extremely pleased with the scent of these products. My hair has never felt so good.

review_title: Best Shampoo A Man Can Get
review_content:
*Caution Warning*
After using the Shampoo and Conditioner I was immediately greeted by numerous women, and given a lumberjack job in the Hinterlands.
Have only tried 5 of Squatch soaps so far but Gold Moss Sctub is tied with one other for my favorite, so far. Love the scent and even more important, so does my wife.

Bay Rum is tied with one other Squatch soap for #1 of the 5 varieties I have tried, so far. I have even been complimented by a young lady standing in line at the grocery store about what I was using. Told her it's just the soap I use to shower and she didn't believe it!
I bought three different scents and this one is pretty amazing. Plus, it exfoliates much better than anything you'll find in the big box stores. Good on ya, oatmeal!
My hair feels great, this after one use. I can't wait to see how great my hair feels after several washes, especially as my hair is thinning the older I get. Smells great too!

review_title: Love the soap, unfortunately a poor value
review_content: I love the scent of the soap as well as the exfoliation and the way it makes my skin feel. But this soap is not worth the money. I've used it for five showers now and the bar is almost gone. I can't justify buying this again unless they start providing more soap for the money.

One of my top 3 favorites. Smells exactly how you'd expect (basically a pine tree)
Lather: 3.5/5 - I'm guessing the additives like sand and the pine chips make it lather a little less than the other soaps
Smell: 4.5/5 - Smells fantastic, but not the best of them all
Exfoliation: 5/5 - The sand REALLY does its job 
Overall: 4.5/5 - I'd use this soap after a long, sweaty day, or if I'm covered in dirt

review_title: Great all-around soap that does everything well
review_content:
Lather: 4.5/5
Smell: 4.5/5
Feeling after shower: 4.5/5
Overall 4.5/5 - My 2nd favorite soap, behind the Bay Rum and ahead of Pine Tar (that I've tried so far). Feels great after shower!!!

Smell: 6/5
Lather: 4.5/5
Feeling after shower: 4.5/5
Overall: 5/5 - My favorite bar that I've tried so far, ahead of the Gold Moss and Pine Tar. The smell is THE BEST and lasts forever! It has a very spicy aroma to it, and will be a permanent renewal pick for me from now on.

review_title: The aloe is great for people with dry skin!
review_content:
Smell: 3/5
Lather: 5/5
Feeling after shower: 5/5
Overall: 4.3/5 - Not in my top 3 tried so far, but this definitely has me feeling the freshest and cleanest of any of the soaps I've tried. The smell is very mild and reminds me of your typical bar soap smell, but if you have dry skin/skin problems, GET THIS SOAP! You feel amazing getting out the shower.

This is the first time I have ever used an all natural hair care product. Really just getting used to how it lathers up and makes my hair feel afterwards. The smell of it isn't super great or anything but it's definitely not an offensive smell at all. Still happy that I made the switch to the Dr Squatch brand. Looking forward to whatever product y'all have in store for the future.

I don't know what to say about this product other than y'all have achieved pure perfection with the conditioner. The way my hair feels after a few days since receiving the shampoo n conditioner is just absolutely kick ass! The tingly feeling after about 90 seconds on your head is pretty rad. Kinda lets you know the product is at work!! Smells awesome as well.

Decided to try Dr. Squatch's Gold Moss man soap. Came out of the shower smelling like moss. Preeeeetty sure I like it...a lot. it makes me smell like a forest man...without the gross BO, and unwashed a$$ smells. Now I have the 2 and a half men song stuck in my head.

review_title: Not my favorite Dr. Squatch product
review_content: The smell was okay (in my opinion), but my girlfriend hated it and no longer wanted to shower with me because she "didn't want to smell like a roofer". The scrub in it left scratches all over my skin because the pieces of whatever it was would stick out a half centimeter and I would have to manually break them off the bar. That being said, my skin was soft after using it. I won't be buying it again though.

Admittedly, I have sensitive skin, that's why I like homemade soaps. And I love the smell of this soap. Unfortunately the skin on my face reacted in the most heinous way to this soap. Bumps all over and I feel like I have a sunburn. Tried it for a week to try and let my skin acclimate but had to give it up. Will try the other flavors I ordered but have pretty low hopes at this point.

I tried out a bar of this as a stocking stuffer for Christmas this year for my guy. I will say, it has a very pleasant scent but it tends to dissolve pretty quickly and I can't see it lasting for more than a week or so. Pretty pricey for 1 bar of soap. Maybe it's because we both take super hot showers but regardless. It also leaves the shower super slippery, pretty much requiring to clean it after every use. Even the daily maintenance shower spray cleaner I use doesn't dissolve the residue.

I decided to try this scent for my first bar and subscribed after the first few uses. The smell is AMAZING, but I am just disappointed that it has not been a week yet and I have already gone through 50% of the bar. However, I did read that there are varying factors in why the soap wears away faster, but I am still disappointed that I may not be able to have it last at least 2 weeks. Nevertheless, still an awesome bar of soap.

review_title: Does what it's supposed to do.
review_content: Saves your soap, no nonsense. I have had it for a year so far and I guess you can say it's ptetty durable to be a light piece of cedarwood. Gives your soap a light complementary woodsy smell after each use. Only problem I would point out is that the soap sometimes will stick to it but a quick solution instead of tearing your bar apart to get it off is to lightly wet it under the showerhead and then pull off gently.

This was my very first buy from Dr. Squatch and I must say. Not happy. Soap? - Yes... Happy. Soap Saver? No... not at all. The "Picture" on the website makes it look like this really cool wood block with rounded edges, and the wider face/ridge in the middle with the logo burned in.. what I got looks like it was made out of a piece of wood scrap, all the edges are sharp, not at all like what they have pictured on the website. I wasn't expecting a wooden sculpture, but come on... at least send me the product on the website, not something your cousin Jeff banged out in 18 seconds after he was done trimming a door frame. Wish I could upload a picture. It's laughable to say the least.

holy fucking shit!!! i was not expecting this, i bought this soap on the whim of a facebook ad, which was perhaps the best thing i could have done. This soap is amazing, its hard to convey how good and masculine this stuff smells and the cleanliness one feels after you shower, just buy it! now! Prior to Dr.Squatch, i used dove's body wash for men and after just one shower, i took all my dove stuff and put them where they belong; in the trash. You have a life long customer right here, my skin thanks you and the women who squeeze me that much harder thanks you as well.

review_title: Great for long hair, if you use it correctly
review_content:
I've grown quite of fond of Dr Squatch's products, their soaps are awesome and I expected the same from their Hair Care kit. I'm happy to say the kit is every bit as good as their other stuff, but it comes with a disclaimer.

If you have long hair, do not use conditioner everyday as advertised. Doing so will cause your oils to latch onto your hair like glue, and instead of your hair looking and feeling healthy, it'll look dull, and feel very greasy. You only want to condition the same day you wash, which brings me to another point.
