Washing your hair every 3-4 days is ideal as you will have to use a bit more than what they recommend in order to give your hair a good clean. This stuff does the job well but working it into a lather is a little more effort than with other shampoos. I recently got a shampoo pump with mine, and I use 1 squeeze of the pump for my top, sides, and back of my scalp, so 4 in total that I use to work into a nice lather. It cleans very well, and doesn't leave your hair damaged or brittle, allowing the oils to come in and give it a fantastic feel and look. 

Aside from that, my only other complaint is the scents, I can not wait to have the shampoo in cool citrus as well, or something that compliments their pine tar soap. 

Those are really my only critiques with this stuff, it's basically everything I wanted, and I will continue to keep using Dr Squatch so long as I possibly can, as far as I'm concerned nothing comes close.
Either my senses are fading with age or this soap has a very weak scent. Lathers great though. Bay Rum all the way baby!

The conditioner is nothing special. It left my hair chalky feeling. Beyond that, I am not a big fan of Pogostemon Cablin (Patchouli) Leaf Oil, so for me the conditioner is useless. Too many bad memories of grad school and a female classmate who overpowered the room with her use of patchouli.... I got my conditioner through the Kickstarter campaign. Like the shampoo though!
We love it... the scent, the way it makes your hair feel, how healthy it is for your hair, all of the natural products used in it and how affordable it is.

AWESOME for your face!! I'm 25 and have suffered from Acne periodically since I was a teen. not only is this a great body cleanser, but Ive started using it on my face as well and my breakouts are significantly better. and it surprisingly tones (no more redness) great smell too. if only they had the same scent in a face lotion! Defiantly recommend.

review_title: You'll be yodeling in the shower
review_content: I've been using this great shampoo and conditioner for a couple of weeks, after getting my package from the kickstarter campaign. Since using, my hair is super easy to manage, and I use far less hair product for styling. I also suffer from dry scalp due to hard water and living in a dry, mountain environment. Since using this product, I haven't yet felt the need to grab a dry scalp shampoo or scalp damaging dandruff shampoo. The smell is amazing, and the price is just right. Give it a shot, gents!!
tried the pine tar for the first time today and wow. totally different feel than the big name store soaps. i will be getting a subscription starting next month!!!

review_title: This one is an acquired taste
review_content: The more I use the Deep Sea Goats Milk, the more I like it. Smooth, with a light floral scent. It makes your skin feel great.

Used it for the first time two days ago. Took a shower at 0630 and when I came home at 2000 my girlfriend commented on how good I smelled still. The smell is amazing and will last all day. The Bay Rum is a clean spicy smell, that will linger just enough where you get a "wiff" every now and then; reminding you as to how a man should smell. If you want a little jazz in you soap, and are sick of smelling like a high school kid from 2004; try it. Kick the store bought garbage, and try something that you can actually feel good about using! Going for the Pine Tar soap tomorrow! Thanks, from the deep woods of Northern Michigan- JN

review_title: Pine Tar Makes Me Tingly All Over
review_content: I bought this stuff for myself for Christmas. This Pine Tar Soap is freaking awesome. Just ordered the Moss, the Sage, and another Pine Tar. Sorry babe but the soap that smells like rainbows and unicorns in my shower is gone.

Guys don't bother trying anything else out there! I have been hunting for a product like this for years! This combo is great for my hair and scalp. I wont use anything else as long as this product is available.
The smell will have your bathroom smelling of fresh cedar and citrus which is a great combination! Cleans well but smell does not carry over onto your skin. Still a great bar!
dont get me wrong i love the soap to death but after using it a few days the scent was starting to get to me.
Love the smell,definitely a winner...
Great smelling soap and doesn't dry my skin. I'm going to try Bay Rum and Pine Tar next!

After using the soap and realized they weren't going to last in my shower I decided to give this a go. The soap does stick to the soap saver and dries the bar out quicker I've never had an issue getting the bar off the soap saver. If it ever gets stuck I just run the soap and soap saver over the water and it frees up right away. So far I love the soap and the soap saver so let's see what the shampoo and conditioner does! I'm hoping there will be a face wash soon with the Pine Tar scent.

I love the scent. It is me to a tee because I love cedar and citrus. The issue I have with it is the scent is too light. You just don't really smell it lathering up unless you smell the bar. I wish it were stronger like Pine Tar, otherwise it would be my favorite. There is no scrub in this soap so it is slippery compared you pine tar. It is still a great non drying soap, but it is hard to beat pine tar.

There is nothing like this soap. It's completely addicting. It is strong smelling and very scrubby. It smells "of" pine, but nowhere like pine sol cleaner. It is worth the money because it is unique and delivers as a quality non drying soap. I don't think I can live without it anymore.

I wasnt sure what to expect from this brand of soap being a new customer and all but decided to give it a shot. The scents take some getting used too, but they grow on you and make your skin feel great. Only issue i can find is that the scent doesn't stay on your skin long after showering. Going to eventually try all the others.
I really love the soap and it smells awesome! The only problem is it didn't last long enough. Maybe I took too many showers because I enjoyed the scent so much.

Not sure I'd call the scent "Uplifting Ocean Breeze" or "Cypress Coast" as the description says. It's more of a "this smells like it's gettin' my hair really clean" kinda smell. And it sure does. I've never used a shampoo that makes my hair feel this clean. I find I have to use just a bit more than a dime sized amount, but this shampoo is fantastic.
BTW...the conditioner doesn't suck either.

I really wanted to like this product and was really excited when I got it in the mail. I opened the box and theover whelming stench of pine-sol cleaner invaded my nostrils. I decided to seperate the bars and let them air out a little. Nope. No change. I took a shower with the soap. And ehh it was ok. Left me smelling like I had been rolling in the before mentioned cleaning supplies. As I said in the title. I'm very disappointed. I've been using grandpa pine tar soap for years. And that leaves you feeling good after a shower. And smelling manly. Like you've been strolling through a forest with a fire going. Guess I'll be switching back

review_title: I gave Dr. Squatch a try 2 weeks ago...
review_content:
I gave Dr. Squatch a try after seeing an advertisement online, and decided to look into it. For years, I have used all types of men's body wash. Most all of the top brands you'd find in most stores, I have them a shot. With the body washes marketed towards men with scents like "Desire" "Manly Man" "RattleBear" "Glacier" "Nighthawk" "Dragon Tamer" you name it, I probably gave it a shot. I read how Dr. Squatch used natural ingredients, and handmade soap, and I have to admit, it caused me to think about what was in all these wild and crazy body washes I'd grown accustomed to. A lot of these body washes had ridiculously strong scents, which I wasn't a fan of. It felt like I was doused in cologne as I showered.

Then, Dr. Squatch arrived. I'll admit, I was a bit weary of bar soaps. I had been scarred into thinking that all bar soaps left my skin feeling like there was residue that left my skin feeling very dry. I gave the ole Sqautch a try, and here it what I loved about it. First, was the lather. This soap really lathered well whether it be scrubbed in my bare skin, or used with a washcloth. The scent was just right, it wasn't too strong, nor to weak. It was the perfect amount for me. The soap washes off easily, and after drying off, I never got the feeling of a residue on my hand. I really like this soap, it just fits my personality and preferences.

Gold Moss is an absolute incredible scent. I really don't know how to describe it. It's a perfect masculine scent that appeals to the men, and the ladies dig it. It's got earthy undertones, with a hint of spice. It smells warm, sophisticated, and what a mature lad should smell like. 

Give it a try, I don't think I'll be going back to men's body washes.

Got this particular scent in my first SoapScription box, and I really like this soap. First off, Dr. Squatch will now be replacing all of the previous men's body washes that I have been using. Other brands that claim they know how a man should smell just doesn't quite cut it. I don't want to smell like I just bathed in cologne when I get out of the shower. Dr. Squatch Spearmint Basil scrub smells fantastic. It has a clean and minty scent, with various spices in the undertone. It's not overbearing, nor is it underwhelming. For me, it's just right. I feel energized as I scrub and smell fantastic once I dry off that stays with me for the day.

Give it a shot.
You'll get used to the awesome power of this bar, first shower and I never felt cleaner, makes you want to run out and get dirty.
I normally smell like Bigfoots crotch but after I did the rubadubdub number with Dr. Squatch Pine Tar soap I smell like a MAN!!
I ordered a soap saver and got the newly designed one with angled channels. It works great, soap sticked slightly but I coated with some mineral oil and solved that problem. Works great!!
For those not getting enough scent these are oil based so dab some on your wrist rub them together to warm the oil and bam!! Your a squatch in the pines!

I don't believe there has ever been a moment where I have felt so clean! Upon opening the box, I instantly knew that this was the soap for me. Great lather, and an even greater scent. I will include this bar in my orders to come!
Wow. This might be the best bar of soap I have EVER had the pleasure of using. Can't wait to try more scents.

review_title: the best smelling soap i've ever used
review_content: I used to use shower gel but never really had that "squeaky clean" feeling when getting out of the shower. This stuff lathers really well, has an amazing smell. You guys have a customer for life.

I've ordered twice and I especially loved the way the Gold Moss Scrub smells. I wasn't wild about Bay Rum, it kind of reminded me of those cinnamon candles. Scent aside, I have very sensitive skin and most store-bought soaps leave me with an itchy rash but Dr. Squatch does not. I just wished they would ship orders a lot faster. Both times were slow, but this time it took them a week just to ship my order and will take another 4 days to get here from what is only about a 4-hour drive. Seriously guys, most businesses are able to ship orders within a day or 2, a week just makes me think you guys are being lazy.

review_title: You should probably buy a different one.
review_content: The soap saver looks cool and is the perfect size for the soap, but the soap sticks extremely badly. I expect the amount of soap saved by using this is at least cancelled out by the chunks that get pulled off every time you take a shower. There are lots of these on the market, and you would probably be better off buying one of them at a significant fraction of this price.

review_title: This soap is truly the best wash I have ever used.
review_content: I used all kinds of shampoos and body washes and nothing compares to Dr. Squatch! It has the best scent, gives me the best clean feel, and also leaves my bathroom smelling amazing for hours after a shower. I recommend to everyone!
This shave soap gives me a slick razorburn free shave. Smells great and my face feels very smooth after.
Found my new favorite

review_title: Great Bar of Soap - too pricy
review_content: The scent and scrub are a great combo, however, Bar is almost gone after a week. Paying $1.50 per ounce? Disappointing...
So I bought three bars. Cedar citrus lasted about 4 days, shower morning and evening. For the price I'm not impressed.
I absolutely love the smell of this! Helps me to wake up and feel refreshed first thing in the morning.

Tested this out for the first time after using a Body Wash product for a while. The difference was so substantial on multiple levels. The shower was more invigorating and woke me up more than using the drab body wash. I know I smelled awesome. My skin feels like it was moisturized instead of being dried out. 

As a bearded dude, I lathered this up in my beard instead of using shampoo and I noticed a difference in quality there too. My beard felt treated and has helped my beard oil treatment in preventing any beardruff.

Highly recommended from me.

The Soap Saver was an automatic add on when I started my subscription, but didn't arrive with the soap. I was back ordered. I received the tracking info once it did ship, but still hasn't arrived, even though I received my second soap order. Which is a story in itself...

review_title: Smell like a Mountain Man Should!
review_content: This by far is a true winner! I love the smell and it actually sticks with you all day even while hard at work in a plant! Customer for life!
Get some. You will be very happy.

Just got my first bat of pine tar. In the shower it was such a blissful smell. It hydrated my skin and had an amazing lather to it. I see other reviews say it costs too much but it is well worth the money for such an awesome product that is made in the USA. I'll be adding more bars to my subscription today!! Highly recommended!!
As soon as I received this soap I literally huffed it for an hour straight it smells amazing

Decided to give Squatch a try. Had a conflict with my order due to ordering on a mobile device and having a conflict with the web site. My order got a little messed up but the CS was great and made it right promptly. I switched from a brand that their soap was a considerable amount lager bar soap. Decided to give these guys a try and am very happy I did. 

The production of suds is crazy! Even though these bars are smaller, I am willing to bet that it produces more than the larger bar competitor. Along with that, my skin is the softest it's been since I can remember and do not need lotion like I used to. 

For longevity, I get wet and turn my shower head to water save, sud up, and place the bar on edge out of the way of splashing water so it will dry out nicely. 

Glad I made the switch!
Love this soap! My skin felt great all day and the smell lasted all day. Blown away!

I got the sampler bundle deal...however I have to be honest. I am not completely satisfied. The soap works well do not get me wrong, BUT the scent of the soaps do not last long. I am the type of person, that I want to smell good all day long. After the shower the scent wears of with in about an hour. For $7 a bar I expected more. So if you're the same way, these soaps are not for you.

I usually use old spice 3 in 1 hair/body wash. I just got my bars in the mail today (pine tar/aloe) and took my first shower with it! IT WAS AWESOME! I just got off accutane and have been getting my skin back to where it wants to be hydration wise. I take two showers a day and normally i have to lather on tons of lotion after my showers. With this stuff i washed my skin, my face, and my short hair. No hint of dry skin! WHAT IS THIS SORCERY!? Dr. Squatch you hit the nail on the head with this stuff. I will definitely be a return customer. My skin and hair seriously feel amazing thank you so much. Completely worth the price even though they are smaller bars. I might report back with how long it lasts me, and if i see a significant reduction in acne scars on my face or anything positive! (also saw you on a facebook ad in case you wanted to know for marketing purposes) THANKS!

review_title: I agree: This is the world's most perfect conditioner for men.
review_content: I've used lots of different conditioners through my life... and this one is the best. It's the only one that's actually made my scalp tingle, and I feel like my hair is fuller after just 1 week of use. The fragrance is natural and invigorating, and I generally love everything about this stuff. Will use forever.

I'm still getting used to this whole "Use only 2 to 3 times a week" thing with the shampoo...but man, it sure works! It smells natural and great, and it does seem to have a powerful cleaning effect. It blows away scalp buildup and it completely removes oil from every strand of hair. I do think it's strong, so using only 2-3 times a week does indeed make sense!

I've been using both of these products as recommended, and my hair is fuller and awesome after like 1 week. Both products smell natural & invigorating! The shampoo is very powerful, so they recommend only using it 2-3 times a week. That part was a little bit of a new adjustment for me...but I think it's effective. Highly recommended...I can't imagine any reason I'd ever stop using this hair kit (ever)

I have only tried the Cedar citrus soap, and it is amazing! I feel cleaner than the regular soap i use. It's smell is very similar, if not exactly the same as one of the nicer smells of the northwestern Alaska tundra! You have unintentionally brought one the smells from home into my shower! I am very happy with this purchase, even though I have only used one of the three bars of soap.
It sticks to it every time. I've rinsed it off before i put the soap on and it barely helps. I'm worried its going to ruin the soap like the others have mentioned.

For years I have been frustrated with the pathetic assortment of soap suitable for men. Most have made my skin itch and/or dry. Many seem to be made for the ladies and carry a fragrance that just wasn't for me. You have hit this one out of the park. I'm into my second month and there is no looking back. Thank you
Love this soap.... It's manly! HIGHLY recommend....

review_title: Sit Down Son, About to Make you a Man
review_content:
Pine Tar is absolutely the best scent. I have tried the entire line and I keep coming back to Pine Tar! So, why the title? Well, that is for anyone who would give this lower than a 3 star.

Complaint 1) Dont like the pine smell? I do enjoy intellectually stimulating conversations involving differing opinions. The pine tar soap has a very successful aroma therapeutic effect. Something along the lines of tearing a pine tree out of the ground with your bare hands and rubbing that conifer all over your body. 

Complaint 2) Doesn't last long? This is most likely not the fault of the product. You most likely are putting your bar into the line of fire of your faucet. Water + Soap = Conversion to Suds = Soap Dissolving. OR perhaps you are placing it onto a flat/solid surface with no ventilation to allow the soap to dry which leaves your poor soap to soak in a puddle of water. I refer to the equation again. OR you are holding the soap in your hand and lathering your body directly for the entirety of your shower. Equation still applies. I recommend using a lathering apparatus such as a loofah. Don't worry, the soap more than makes up for the unmanly loofah, besides your soap will last a month and being practical and wise is manly. Do keep the equation in mind. It will help you be wise with your investment.

Complaint 3) Do not like the black scum? Well, the bar is black, it produces black scum. All soap produces a viscous matter you refer to as soap scum. So this is not unique to the pine tar soap; only the black color. This should not be held against the product. It should be met with understanding and acceptance. 

Thank you, Dr Squatch, for a fantastic bar soap.

review_title: Smells fine, but turns things black.
review_content: Aside from the fact that I had to clean my shower all of the time while using this bar of soap, it itself was awesome. Smell was great, the sand was a nice touch for exfoliation. However, I could literally see where the soap had run down the side of my shower where I keep the bar when not in use.
This is one of my favorites so far. Clean, fresh, citrusy, pine smell, that is amazing! Not only that, it doesn't dry out my skin.

This is my favorite scent, I like it more than anything I've ever tried, from stores or internet. Has a nice masculine scent that isn't overpowering. My wife also loves it, she won't stop smelling me after I've showered with it. LOL Doesn't dry my skin out, and leaves my skin feeling soft. Highly recommend this soap!

review_title: Didn't like it! Dries out hair even with conditioner!
review_content: This shampoo has a lot of what it feels like acidic components (I want to say its heavy on the citrus ingredients) that cause my hair to get a slight burning feeling and also strip everything off the hair itself. It dries it out really bad and it also makes it just not feel right. I used this for around a month before I made my review and I have to say Yes....it will clean your hair but it will strip off any oils you have. Now if you have oily hair or you just finished that grimy job at work I think this will work out ok. But if your in a cold, dry area like WA state then its a recipe for disaster. I only used it 1-2x a week as well. I always used the conditioner right after to get it to feel better but even as a combo it feels very "rubbery". Hard to explain but its like you cleaned the plastic tupperware bin from your sink with a strong soap and get that squeaky clean feel to it when you run your hands across it. Very rubbery and tough. Overall this shampoo is VERY strong and I would say maybe cut it to 1 time every 2 weeks. It does what it states but it also isn't very soothing or pleasing to use. I wish the shampoo cleaned my hair without being so rough or so drying to the point it makes my hair brittle. If this was a bit less harsh then I would enjoy it more. Save your money and buy the bar soap. Rub bar soap in on your head, rinse, and then add conditioner with it. Same job as this shampoo but less expensive, more gentle on your hair, and less bottles to travel with.

WOW! I love this conditioner! The way it makes your hair feel after your done using it is awesome. It moisturizes it very well to the point that even when I'm done drying off with a towel, my hair still feels very slick and slightly wet. Doesn't have a greasy feel or anything it just feels like really nice hair. I also noticed my hair color change just a bit. I have black hair and when I started using this (been using it for 1 month), my hair changed to a really dark brown. I also didnt get that much of any tingling sensation like others say in their reviews. I do get a slight cooling feel to it which is nice. 

 The consistency is also really good. I put it in a dispenser so whenever I need it, its easy for me to portion control it. A little goes a long way! It feels like its not real thick when it gets in your hair but don't let that fool you. Its a very milky consistency comparable to hand lotion so when using this in a pump setup, you shouldn't experience any clogging. Overall great product that with the size bottle these guys sell, you can rest assured this bottle will go a LONG way. Don't let the price deter you from purchasing it. I have used this every day (2x a day) for a month and I probably have gone through a bit over 1/4 of a bottle. One tip....dont buy the shampoo! Just use your hand soap and this product. Shampoo isn't the best (really dries your hair out) but using this with the bar soap is a perfect combo! 

Thank you Dr Squatch team for another great product!

I work as a land surveyor, and after days of trekking through the Georgia heat that turns on about noon this time of year, I get off work pretty ripe. This stuff works wonders - not only is it a fantastic scent that sticks to you for the rest of the day and into the next morning, it fills up the entire bathroom and just kinda stays there. 

I haven't yet had an issue with my skin being too dry like with usual bar soaps, and I always have people asking what cologne or deodorant I'm wearing. Dr. Squatch makes an incredible products.
I love this soap. Not only is it an incredible scent, it makes my skin feel amazing. By far one of the best I've ever used.

review_title: From the first time I applied...
review_content: Just bought this for the first time. My wife noticed it right away after my first application. She came up to me and said, you smell amazing..what is that? I told her and she remarked that it is one of the best scents I've ever worn. Talk about an incentive to keep purchasing this one.
Don't like this one.

I have crazy hair, its fine yet curly/wavy and I have an incredibly difficult time keeping it from frizzing without using gel or wax, which makes my face break out. this conditioner was the magic I needed and works awesome.

review_title: Nice but not at that price
review_content: I like the smell of the product it does not last long and at $42 dollars an ounce you can keep it. The smell from my pine tar soap lasts longer and is 7 bucks a bar sorry guys way to expensive.

Let me start by saying I'm head over heels for the bar soaps. The shave soap has a great smell and lathers very thick. However the suds disappear before I can even lather my entire face. I've tried straight from the can and mixing it with water and brush in a mug. If they could make the lather last longer I'd switch from my shave soap I've used for over a decade.

Ok maybe not that good but it's amazing. Bay Rum has been my favorite scent out of the 5 scents I've tried. It leaves my normally dry skin moisturized. The scent is very heavy in the shower but kind of rinses of. Hints of it will be there for a while but kinda wish the scent stayed longer because the smell is amazing. The lather is out of this world and goes a long way. Great products. Customer for life.
Just received my second shipment today. Absolutely love your soaps. Even my wife says they smell great!

review_title: Hands down the BEST soap I've ever used!!!
review_content: You simply cannot go wrong with purchasing this bar! The smell is exquisite and the feeling it leaves your skin with is amazing! I had to up my soapscription due to the fact that my teenage sons started taking over my bars lol!

The Bay Rum bar is something quite exquisite! Not only does it smell amazing it also left my skin feeling smooth and refreshed. I even had to up my soapscription to 3 bars a month due to my teenage sons taking over my bars lol!

So after buying my first bar of soap from my amazon prime account and fell in love, I figured I'd give the Soapscription a try. I signed up and paid early Monday morning to only find out that my soaps would not arrive for 7 days. Knowing this now, I wouldn't of signed up right away since I am in need of the new soap and I'm going away this weekend. Will be buying different soap to hold me over until my soaps arrive but I'm definitely disappointed.

review_title: Love the scent of oak moss
review_content: Scrubs up nice, bay rum seems to still be my go to. Love all these products.
I swear by the products these guys put out because they just seem to work! Lathers up well and makes your face nice and slick.
You know you've been debating whether or not to. It's worth it.
Carrying my favorite soap was always a no-go on trips. This bag is perfect and durable.

Not impressed with this grade school quality soap saver. Seems cheap, the stain comes off the saver and onto your soap (so you're pretty much washing your body with great soap + lacquer), and is way over priced. They should be giving these away for free.

I had high hopes for the Pine Tar. The exfoliating is nice, but the scent is overpowering, maybe a little to squatchy. My wife would not get near me for two weeks. If you want to smell like a musty Portland Hipster (I know as I was born and raised there), then this is the scent for you. Not manly, just musty.

This should be renamed the soap sticker. Yes, it does keep you soap dry thus extending the life, but the soap sticks the the wood block. Every time you take it off, it will leave little chunks of soap behind. I even soaked it in vegetable oil but it still did not help. Two stars because it smells good.
This is a nice smelling soap. Citrus with a cedar hint, but not overpowering like other scents. Nice and mellow. I I'll be including this scent in my next order.
great soap not my favorite but it leaves you feeling clean and refreshed great soap definitely suggests giving it a try

Well this is my hands down favorite waiting on my next order ordered some of the ones I haven't tried to get a feel for the other products and I can say this dr squatch soap is amazing can't wait to take a shower!!!

review_title: Just try it, and you'll see.
review_content:
I decided to try this after reading about all the nasty chemicals in most big-box store brands, figured that might have something to do with feeling like my hair was dry, brittle, and frazzled. I've had a lot of the Dr. Squatch soaps that are good, but the hair care kit is by far my favorite Dr. Squatch product to date.

The Dr. Squatch shampoo smells amazing and lathers well, hair feels clean and I feel more confident about not rubbing gnarly chemicals on my head every day. The conditioner also smells great, and after leaving it in for a couple minutes as directed, hair feels smooth and soft. After a few weeks of use, I definitely felt like my hair had a little more life and resilience compared to feeling beaten down and scorched by the old stuff.

I bought a second hair care kit within a couple weeks because I liked it so much and figured I should just get more to have on hand when I run out. Highly recommended.

First, the soap saver is machine made, not handmade. Second, it's a ripoff priced at $12.00. I could manufacture and sell these for $5.00 and still make at least 100% profit. Don't waste your money. Save it for the soap.
Love the scent and the feeling. But, the stuff simply falls apart in hot showers. Mine completely melted. Please, make it harder or just sell it in a bottle.
The Pine Tar is Ok but don't like the black drainage freaked the wife out she was asking will it stain shower floor told her it would not will drain away.

Great soap, love the scents and smells. But soaps are way too small and do not last long. My soaps last about a week then I have a thin layer of soap left, enough to wash hands a few times. I gave them 4 stars because they do offer a great product and their customer service is awesome!

I've never really noticed a difference until I tried this product. After 2 showers I feel and smell a huge difference! I feel like there should be a commercial similar to the snickers commercial.... you're a Sasquatch when you're dirty lol. I'll be a repeat customer.

Product as advertised! I love it the scent. My skins smells and feels great! Oak moss has taken over as my favorite earthy scent. It used to be patchouli and dragons blood. I highly recommend. Very unique.
Not quite sure what it is, but something about this scent reminds me of my childhood. Only thing that would improve this bar for me would be added exfoliation

review_title: I Really Want To Love It
review_content: The scent is awesome! Its truly a manly scent and has great feel to it. My issue with the bar is that the exfoliation is way too strong. Between the sand and oatmeal, it's like scraping 300 grit sandpaper down your body if you use the bar directly on your skin. Using it with a wash cloth would be fine, but I just can't do it my normal way of bar to skin. Otherwise, its a great soap!
Love the Orange fragrance. Not overpowering, but just right. Definitely feel clean! Will probably try them all.

I love all of the body soaps from these guys and was really excited to try the shampoo and conditioner. It says for all hair types, I myself have pretty thin hair. These product made my hair really greasy feeling and looking. They also gave me pimples on my head front how greasy my hair was! I bet they work wonders on people with thick hair. I love the fact that it's all natural and smells really good!

First, let me say, Dr. Squatch is amazing. so far I have tired the pine tar, bay ram, and now working on the nautical sage, as well as the shampoo and conditioner. the soap is far beyond amazing, I have never felt so good stepping out of the shower in my life. the shampoo and conditioner is equally awesome, to the point i still smell the shampoo 2 to 3 days after washing my hair. just have to use double the amount of each if your man mane is half way down your back. keep up the good work guys, but keep your long haired squatchers in mind \m/

I just recieved my first order of soap, shampoo, and conditioner from you. I have to say I was very pleased. The soap scent lingers after the shower and I still smell the cedar on my skin. Since this was my FIRST use of your product I shampooed my hair first and then used your conditioner. Even after 30 minutes my scap still tingles. I have straight, fine, and oily hair so I will have to test this theory of ONLY shampooing one or two times a week, It remains to be seen if your conditioner will keep my hair cleen and oil free. I really feel cleaner than I have in, well a VERY long time. Three cheers for nice products and I will continue to use them.
The aloe smells fresh as hell, leaves your skin almost tingly when you use it too it's great! Best part about squatch bar soaps is the quality!!
Awesome bar of soap doesnt dry you out lathers like crazy keeps you feeling relaxed soft and smooth your body looks healther shiner great smell i will buy it again .
Love the smell of this. Wish the fragrance stayed with me longer...or that you made a cologne version.

This is by far the best soap I've ever used! I've tried 4 scents so far and love them all will be making my way through the the rest of the scents with my soapscription! Can't wait to get theses next two in the mail. I get excited when my soapscription is fixing to renew. Another benefit, my ol' lady loves the scents and is always up in my face smelling me for like 2 hours after I shower(I swear I'm not trying to promote its the God honest truth) thanks Dr. Squatch for making the best soap I have and probably will ever use! Stay classy!

Love the soap! Ordered my first bar of Pine Tar in January. I've tried quite a few of the other soaps (Citrus, Nautical Sage, and Gold Moss), but I've got to say that this is my favorite. Love the woodsy aroma and how well it exfoliates. Looking forward to my next batch! Once I've tried them all, I feel like I'll be pretty set on the Pine Tar. Looking forward to trying out your shampoo/conditioner.

I'm not smelling cool mint w/citrus as described above. I don't know if anyone has tried Meyer's hand soap but it has that sort of smell...kind of old timey. It's not the best smelling shampoo but the conditioner (and shampoo) really makes my hair feel great. I got an email a few days after I purchased saying they revamped their hair products...I wonder which version I received? Regardless...I wish it smelled better!

review_title: Hope it pops up as my random again soon
review_content: When I first saw the Eucalyptus Greek Yogurt as the random pick of my soapscription, I wasn't overly impressed. Seemed rather feminine, and I wanted man soap. I was wrong. Smells great, cleaned like a champ, and the eucalyptus was a good picker-upper early in the mornings. Now that I'm out, I hope it reappears in my soapscription soon. 5 out of 5, keep up the great work!

The scent of Pine Tar really grabs you by the nose and lands a big uppercut right into your nostrils. The bar does seem to go fast despite using the soap saver; there is a noticeable difference in size even after the first use.

This is one of my favorites. I get this soap with every subscription. It is more of a manly scent and I like the way it lathers as well as moisturizes. I have dry skin on my shins and since using this soap, I never scratch my shins anymore. Can't go wrong with this soap.

I like this soap and it's pretty much gender neutral. Great sea smell and decent lather. Moisturizes all right but not as good as Gold Moss or Aloe Vera. If you don't have really dry skin and you like a soap that has a very pleasing scent, this soap is for you.
This scent is unique and more of a man type scent. Reminds me of a barbershop smell. It lathers really well and does moisturize really well. Not my favorite but still a good soap to try.

Another gender neutral scent that leaves your bathroom smelling great. Not an overpowering citrus smell, just right I would say. Not great at moisturizing but if you don't have dry skin and looking for a soap for a man and a woman, this soap is a good choice.

I really like the Gold Moss but just got the Cool Fresh Aloe and I'm impressed with the scent, lather, and moisturizing. This soap is perfect for both men and woman and will be part of my monthly soapsubscription

I have to admit, I really wasn't expecting much when I decided to add this for a trial. If you follow the directions and use the shampoo 2 to 3 times a week and condition everyday, it really leaves your hair soft and no dry scalp. I've always struggled to find a good shampoo and conditioner that just didn't leave my scalp all itchy. Even the ones that were designed to address that. This works awesome and now this is my main shampoo and conditioner.
Nothing like that great smell of sage in the morning or after a hard day's work.
I've been using this soap for about a year now and it's the best soap I've ever used.
Great variety of soap, clean , fresh, long lasting. A bar lasted me a month, and for the price no complaints. Highly recommend, I ordered 4 bars and I'm into the Pine Tar.
I just used this soap for the first time and it is phenomenal. I've never felt so clean! Only thing is I wish it had a stronger sent.

review_title: Scent and exfoliation is great but don't get the soap around your manly parts
review_content:
I liked the the bar overall just wish it was bigger and lasted longer at this price point. My main problem with the soap is the oatmeal and sand that is in the bar. This may seem odd to say but if I lather or rinse the soap off and some of it comes in contact with my pee hole it has a burning sensation and is painful. I am convinced its because of the sand/oatmeal particles that are in the soap that is causing this. it only lasts for a minute or two but it was enough for me to not want to buy it again. 

Has this happened to any other guys? I find it hard to believe I am the only one having this occurrence when I shower with the soap.
I do feel clean, but I notice almost no scent at all. May not buy this one again.
The soap was great, but the smell wasn't strong enough. He actual bar smelled fine, but the lather and afterwards didn't.
I decided to try this soap based on others reviews. This soap smells very good and cleans very well. I will be ordering more.
It was suppose to be delivered on May 11th and the tracking stopped when DHL was supposed to deliver it to the post office. This happened to two of my friends and I.
This is my second order but the first order of Pine tar. It does what it says! It great for scrubbing off the gunk and stuff! Great smell too! You outdid yourself Doc!
It was my original order, and I think my favorite! Lathers great and the smell stays with you all day! And I kinda like my girlfriend smelling me and smiling all the time!
LOVE THE SCENT!!!!!!!! JOINED THE CLUB, JUST WISH THE BARS WERE BIGGER AND LASTED LONGER

review_title: The best soap from Dr. Squatch.
review_content: Hands down the best. Great scent, hard soap that lasts. Cleans and exfoliates and the invigorating feeling it leaves you with is amazing.
Overall all a very nice soap. Lathers and cleans well. Nice scent. Does a great job and high quality.
A try bay rum with a modern edge. Cleans well and high quality. Not overpowering.

This one is lacking something that their other soaps get right. The bar is softer and last half as long. Also the scent wanes quickly from the bar. If the scent was improved and a harder soap... I would try again.

I never write reviews, but I am compelled to do it here because I everyone should try this stuff (so that they remain in business forever because now I can't go back to my old soap)! I've tried the pine tar and nautical sage so far and both are great! They both smell great and much manlier than any store bought soap I've ever used. The smell doesn't linger for very long, but I attribute that to how extremely well they rinse off. My wife wasn't thrilled about the grey residue left from the pine tar soap (not that it was any big deal to rinse away) so I'll probably be sticking to other bars. I'm going to continue to work my way through the line anyway to try them all. In all honesty, my skin has never felt cleaner or more refreshed in my life. FYI: Using a rag and storing my soap on the soap saver outside the shower, mine are lasting a little over two weeks.

I never write reviews, but I am compelled to do it here because I want everyone should try this stuff (so that they remain in business forever because now I can't go back to my old soap)! I've tried the pine tar and nautical sage so far and both are great! They both smell great and much manlier than any store bought soap I've ever used. The smell doesn't linger for very long, but I attribute that to how extremely well they rinse off. My wife wasn't thrilled about the grey residue left from the pine tar soap (not that it was any big deal to rinse away) so I'll probably be sticking to other bars. I'm going to continue to work my way through the line anyway to try them all. In all honesty, my skin has never felt cleaner or more refreshed in my life. FYI: Using a rag and storing my soap on the soap saver outside the shower, mine are lasting a little over two weeks.

I've experimented with a lot of shampoos and conditioners in my life (I have thick, wavy and frizzy hair that's pretty hard to manage), but I now I can say that as long as this stuff is around, the search for the perfect combination is over. I'm going with the wash once a week and condition daily approach, and have been doing so for about three weeks now. The idea of shampooing only once a week made me uncomfortable at first, but this shampoo gets your hair feeling so clean, that it isn't a problem at all. The conditioner keeps it fresh and smelling good (and the shampoo and conditioner do smell great and not feminine at all) throughout the rest of the week. My hair has never looked better or healthier! And since you only need a little bit for each use, it'll last a very long time.

I haven't worn cologne in quite some time, but I figured I'd give this a shot since I was ordering a few other things here. I'm happy I did! The Hemlock Trail smells great, but it's just not really my sort of thing. A little too piney and woodsy smelling for me (it sounds weird, but this scent seems better suited for a dude with a full beard or something). The Driftwood, however, is the best smelling cologne I've ever used. I'm not real good at describing colognes, but I'd say this has an earthy smell with touches of sandalwood and some citrus too it. Its got a manly smell that's real clean. It's not overpowering either (which is good in my opinion since I just like it to be subtle). I only use two tiny drops on neck and it lasts throughout the day. I wish the big bottle were cheaper, but seeing as though I've only used about two-thirds of the Driftwood sample over the past three weeks (and I've used it daily), I guess it'd last me a real long time. I'll definitely buy the big bottle of Driftwood when my sample runs out!

review_title: It works well, but I have one quirk with it
review_content:
I've been using this bag for use at the gym, so I clean up after a workout or if I have time on my lunch break, and I feel like I need a shower. In the time I've used the bag, it's definitely useful, but it has a problem worth mentioning. The good news is it does dry quickly, but the bad news is the soap ends up getting stuck with the weave and has pieces of it on my soap. So when I take it out I have to rinse it before use. 

I'm thinking a different fabric might be in order, something very breathable, but dries fast and isn't dripping wet like other bags might be.

Not just for drying your soap bar. The bar will adhere to this thing, and that is a good thing because you now can grip it instead of a bar of slippery soap. Another cool thing is that once your soap is about done, just use your next bar of soap and plop it on top of the old soap surface, and there you go. After awhile, you will have built up layers of soap, kind of reminiscent of sedimentary rock.
Give this one a try. It smells great!

I purchased both the shampoo and conditioner. Like most of the reviewers - I must say I was a little skeptical at first to not use the shampoo every day. It has been about a month now and I think the best combination for me (since I workout 5 to 6 days a week) is to shampoo 2 to 3 times a week and condition every day. Now that the month is over my hair looks good and my scalp feels fine. However, I must admit my scalp broke out during the first two weeks . . . . I am calling that the adjustment period ... Lastly - smell-wise . . . the shampoo smells nice and fresh - but, the conditioner is a little to "earthy" for my taste. My opinion - less "earth" in the conditioner and you have a 5-Star product combo!

To date I have tried both the Bay Rum and Nautical Sage soaps. Bay Rum is definitely my favorite so far! The Nautical Sage started out a little too strong on the "sage side" - but, seeing as the sent has all but disappeared after 1 weeks use - it is no longer a problem. Like most of the complaints below - you are lucky to get the physical bar to last a full month. To give potential users some perspective: 1.) I do shower daily - sometimes twice a day depending on my workout schedule, 2.) I am not super "Squatchy" hairy - but do sport a healthy coverage throughout/overall - so I am sure that uses more soap. As to complaints about the bar falling apart - both of mine have not. I did make sure to purchase the Squatch soap holder and that seems to help. Lastly - I have taken the remnants of my first bar of soap and put it and some water into my "TSA approved shampoo container" and created a usable liquid soap for use on my business trips (hint, hint, Dr. Squatch - when are you coming out with some liquid soaps???). Bottom line - yes, I would buy again. Love the natural approach and the initial scent. I look forward to trying the other scents. Just wish the bars would last longer.

I vow to never use commercial body wash or bar soap again. Saw Dr. Squatch ads on Facebook and instantly was hooked after my first order. Pine Tar is arguably the best smelling soap I've ever used, and the ingredients keep my skin smooth and smelling great. I keep mine in a soap dish to save its longevity as well as smell up my bathroom with Piney goodness. The scrub/exfoliation is a really nice touch and it feels good and not too abrasive. Love this soap. You have a returning customer here!

review_title: Love your products but hate your shipping times.
review_content: My favorite bar to date but shipping from a neighboring state should not take 10+ days.
The quality of soap is fine, easy to lather and smell good in the shower, but by the time you dry off that good scent is gone. It's my second scent to try and a little disappointed

review_title: Great Lather with an Excellent Scent that Peters Out Really Fast.
review_content: So I received my Nautical Sage bar of soap today. First thing I noticed was when I ripped open the padded envelope it comes in, that beautiful Nautical Sage scent hit me in the old olfactory nerves and scent me to heaven. I couldn't wait to try it out. It cam in a nice little box with ingredients listed on it and a little blurb about the story of Dr. Squatch. Well lets get to the important stuff. Now I'm a guy who likes his soap to lather and I also like the scent of the soap to last at least half the day if not longer. Well this soap delivers in the lather department for sure and the scent permeates through the whole bathroom while you're using it. Sadly that wonderful Nautical Sage scent goes straight down the drain as soon as you rinse the soap off. I was so disappointed in this soap as far as how long the scent lasts. When you have so many different scents to offer in your products and that scent only lasts while you're in the shower, I'd say you're doing your customers a disservice because that bar of soap costs upwards of $7 to $10 and that aint cheap for a bar of soap. Yeah it's natural and all but the scent is 90% of the sale. Bottom line, if I'm going to pay an arm and a leg for a bar of soap, I want that arm and leg to smell like that bar of soap for most of the day. Pun intended. I'm sorry to say that when I'm done with my wonderful bar of Dr. Squatch Nautical Sage soap, I'll be moving on and this time I wont be so foolish as to fall for some newfangled natural great smelling soap. Thank you Dr. Squatch for a great time in the shower, even though it didn't last, I still wish you good luck and may you be prosperous in the years to come.

First time I've been disappointed with a Dr Squatch product. 

While it smells nice, and all that jazz, there's no actual Aloe Vera in the ingredients list. Bummer.... If you like to smell like aloe without any of the actual benefits of Aloe (I got this to use in the summer months), then go on ahead and snag this one up.
I didn't really like the smell, it wasn't bad just not what I thought.

I used this soap first as part of my 3 bar trial. Soap is a good product but nothing exceptional. Tends to be used up quickly and smell is a little too subtle. Definitely a nice to have not need to have item. My evaluation is $4-5 per bar

I used this soap second as part of my 3 bar trial. Soap is a good product but nothing exceptional. Tends to be used up quickly and smell is a little too subtle. Definitely a nice to have not need to have item. My evaluation is $4-5 per bar. And the trial offering should be much less than $27

review_title: Product is just OK. Leaves black marks on the shower walls
review_content: I used this soap first as part of my 3 bar trial. Soap is a good product but nothing exceptional. Tends to be used up quickly and smell is a little too subtle. Definitely a nice to have not need to have item. This soap leaves black marks on the white shower walls. My evaluation is $4-5 per bar and the trial of 3 soaps at $27 is not a great way to attract new customers.
I use a soap saver pouch bag w/draw string found in the beauty section of most department stores. No loss of product, just hang it up to dry until next use, doesn't stick to anything other than bag.
This is a all around good bar of soap with a nice sent, lathers up great, i really like it!!. Waiting to try out Cedar citrus but so far Deep sea Goats milk and Cool aloe are my GoTo's every month!

Tried 3 bars of soap: pine tar, gold moss and cedar citrus. First thing, I noticed I did not need oils after a red hot shower; no itch, no dryness, I have almost stopped using the moisturizers I've used for years after the first bar. Love the pine tar, scent and exfoliation is perfect. Gold Moss, while it performed well, almost had no scent. Little disappointed. Cedar citrus; almost no exfoliant, and scent was barely there. Again, a little disappointed. I was expecting more "in your face" scent out of the second two, but performance is still stunning. I'm an "ashy white guy" most of the time and the soaps alone seemed to have fixed that. Cool. No more having to grease down after a shower.

Been using their soap for a few months and absolutely LOVE IT!! Never thought a soap could leave me feeling squeaky clean, but this literally does, and smells so good! In fact, my wife likes to sneak in the shower and use it too! Keep up the great work!

I spend my days teaching people how to break other people. It is hot, sweaty work and creates a stench. But deodorant soaps are filled with chemicals that should be in a battery, not on my skin. Dr. Squatch Pine Tar smells manly, not perfumey. Chemical free and exfoliating like a real man, with oatmeal and freaking sand!
Buy this. 
Dr. Squatch, I will be a customer for life!

I really enjoyed the cedar citrus. Lasted 4 weeks by putting up high and away from the water. Smell was good but didn't last long. One major issue I have is I didn't see a benefit switching to this soap nor did I see any worse affect once I finished the bar. I use either dove or old spice bar soap and cannot see any benefit. If the price was lower, I might consider another purchase. Overall, a very good bar of soap. Would love to try the other smells as well.

My skin Thanks, the Ladies Thank you as well. I love this soap. I've used several different genres of the soaps. Find myself spending more time in the shower these days. Holy Moly Batman!! Thanks Dr. Squatch. Only One complaint..... I spend to much time in the shower these days and my water bill has gone up....

I've looked for a NPA certified natural shampoo that doesn't dry my scalp and a conditioner that truly conditions and one that isn't three hundred dollars for 12 oz of nonsense. This stuff truly works and just like the directions imply, your hair and scalp gradually get healthier every day. I had severe psoriasis and this has tamed it and kept it at bay after just one bottle. You've got a repeat customer Dr. Squatch!
Love the soap ... GOOD STUFF ! I am a fan!

I used to use old spice and axe shampoo and thought it was amazing. After trying this I realize it's not. This is by far the greatest shampoo I've ever used. I will be using this as long as it's around. I love the smell of it and how I can smell it throughout the day, but it's not over powering either which is great. Not as good smelling as the soaps tho. Was also impressed with the free shipping on this. I'm subscribed to soap scription and knew I got free shipping on it but figured I'd be charged shipping for the hair care since I didn't have a hair care subscription. The Dr. Squatch for great products all around. I can't wait to try the cologne. Hey, maybe you guys can make deodorant next?

Soap doesn't lather right no matter what you do. Water more, water less, whip it this way or that way nothing. Lather comes out thin and doesn't provide much for cushion, slickness, or protection. Save your money and purchase else where. Product is very expensive as well.
I can't wait to take another shower. I love the exfoliating properties of the soap and the smell is outstanding.

I pinged Dr Squatch a while ago about the idea of a dish of some sort so I could keep/use their soap at the gym. I was thinking of a hard plastic case, like a normal soap dish, but one Squatch shaped. Then they came out with this travel bag. Bought it as soon as I saw it. I was concerned about the material; putting a wet soap bar into and then the bag into my dopp kit. Still no problems. The bag started to darken, as if it was getting wet or getting moldy, and would soon leak. It is moisture, but it still doesn't leak. The better feature, over a plastic soap dish, is that it does dry out the soap. Very content.

review_title: Showering at a whole new level
review_content: I don't know if it was destiny or my deep seated love for sasquatch that made me click on the Facebook ad, but my showering life will never be the same. I'm a man of the outdoors, and I am overjoyed to find a company that allows me to bathe in its scents. Showering has become my favorite part of the day. There are times I find myself going into the bathroom just to smell my soaps. They're that good. Also, I have had issues with dry skin my whole life, and the pine tar soap scrubs and cleans my skin thoroughly without drying it out. If anything, my skin is in better condition than ever before. Needless to say, I now have a subscription and am currently waiting for my hair kit to come in the mail.

This is my first soap as I've started my subscription last week. Took it for a spin this morning, throwing out my old soap that wasn't even finished. I plan on trying them all and i must say this soap delivers on so many different levels. Great lather, great for all skin types, and the SMELL!!!! Walking into the bathroom my wife and I can smell the soap instantly. WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE Dr. Squatch!!!

I have been using Dr.Squatch for over a year or so now.There are 1 or 2 soaps that I don't particularly care for,but for the most part I'm glad that I started using it.The customer service is very abliging and 2nd to none. I just wish they had t-shirts.....Give it a try..... You'll like it :thumbsup::thumbsup::thumbsup::thumbsup::thumbsup::thumbsup::thumbsup::thumbsup::thumbsup:........ Jim

review_title: Not for people who have naturally oily hair
review_content:
I have naturally oily hair and I tried the recommendation of only washing my hair 2-3 times a week and using the conditioner daily, my hair just simply can't do this. By day 2, my hair was so oily that it looked like I had been working out and my hair was wet. I love the way the product smells, but if you are someone with naturally oily hair, you have two options either not buy or wash your hair every day. 

Very disappointing as I love the soap and cologne :(

I bought a sample set for my son as a gift and the shampoo set also. His text to me a week after using it was "This soap is really good! I don't stink and I'm only taking a shower once a day. No deodorant most of the time. I bet the perfumes in other soaps were causing the stink" Just had to pass this on to you guys with a smile!

review_title: Smells good for a few minutes
review_content: This is an awesome cologne. Although it doesn’t last very long at all.

I find the smell to be a little weird but not unpleasant. It does wash off black and could make the shower a little messy. My biggest complaint though is how gritty it is. All the sand makes it too abrasive and almost painful to wash with. All that being said if you used any of their other soaps you still leave the shower with that clean fresh feeling

...or the fundamental element to my junior high janitor's mop bucket. This stuff definitely brings back the memories, but I can't say I want my hair smelling like the stuff that "Cookie" used to clean up our football locker room. 
The positive, though - it definitely gets your hair clean, without leaving it feeling too dry like some other all-natural shampoos. Smelling like a cleaning agent, it better leave my hair nice and dirt/oil free.

Right out of the box, the Travel Bag appears to be well thought thru, i.e., the bar fits nicely, closes quickly and travels well in my spa bag. I go to the gym maybe 5 times a week so it gets a good workout. I had just finished showering with my favorite soap, the Cool Fresh Aloe, I shook the excess water from the bar, placed back in to the bag and then into my spa kit. The next day, as I was preparing to shower, I reached for the Travel Bag and it was already fairly soaked. I open and pulled the soap out and it had become fairly soft, almost to the point of decomposing. A portion of the soap was still inside the bag, unavailable for me to use in the shower. I found this to be unacceptable. I went to my CVS Pharmacy and purchased a plastic soap container for under a dollar and that appeared to have solved the problem. I love your products but this particular item does not meet expectations.

I was looking for another soap to use because my Dove Men's favorite isn't always in stock and that bugs me. So I went on a search and found Dr. Squatch. I decided to give it a shot I bought 2 bars one Cedar Citrus and Bay Rum. I started with the Cedar because the quiz recommended that one. So far it has not dried my skin out. Since my hospital ordeal my skin is thin. I like the scent of the Cedar Citrus and from what I smell of the Bay Rum can't wait to try that one.
I am hoping the product continues to preform. If the bar doesn't last that long that's okay as long as I don't have to use lotions as much. Sorry for the long rant but thought I would give a decent review to help others choose. Also I forgot I am also Diabetic which leads to dry skin or skin issues. Have a Squatch day!

After reading reviews a couple of years ago I decided to try Gold Moss and fell so much in love with it that i immediately subscribed and have been using ever since. This is the best soap I've ever used hands down and I love the Gold Moss so much I'm afraid to try other scents. I just don't see how anything else will measure up and don't want to be disappointed. After writing this though, I think I'll bite the bullet and order a couple other scents to try....going with Pine Tar and Nautical Sage...wish me luck!!
This is one of my favorites. Lathers well and exfoliates. The smell is very manly.
I've tried almost all the soaps and I settled on this one, the spice smell is great with a hair of pine!
Very Nice scent, excellent long lasting lather..Love it. Lon lasting..

review_title: This is my favorite Scent, Awesome
review_content: This is my go to soap, the scent is awesome..reminds me of my days getting a good old fashion haircut.

Aside from the fact that I have been far more pleased with this soap than any other soap or body wash I have used, The customer service has been simply amazing. Had some issues with shipping times, and issues with the system when trying to make a purchase, and they cleared it right up. Greg actually talked to me like I was a person, not another number in a ledger, and it was great. My issues were taken care of quickly, and I'm on to trying a couple of new bars. Not quite ready to make the leap to trying the cologne or shampoo, but I'm getting there.

I work in the tree business and this soap smells dead on like the pine trees I work around. I can still smell the soap and feel it's skin soothing effects 3 hours after my shower; that's awesome. Best soap I ever used and I will continue to get it here forth. Let me tell you, my line of work is a dirty one and this soap lather well and cleans my skin after a long ahed day of dirt, sweat, and wood chips.

I'm new to Dr. Squatch, and want to give it a fair shot. Admittedly, the price is higher than any commercial soap. That, right off the bat has me thinking this has GOT to be special to be worth the additional expense. Like most informed consumers, I read the reviews prior to purchasing. They sounded so good I seldom found a negative. "Hm. Only employees writing reviews?", I wondered. Looking for a woodsy, pine scent that lasts with a natural bar, I gave this a shot. 

Much ado about not much, to be honest. Everybody is different. But based on the comments, I was expecting to be knocked out with the strength of the smell of pine and all things forest. Not so. Because of the reviews and comments, this was weak. 

Not a fan of exfoliating. But that was my choice. But I was looking for a natural bar soap with a lasting aroma. I was hoping to have found the Holy Grail of my quest, but ultimately realize that its not so. 

I would not order this again because exfoliating annoys me and this just didn't deliver as advertised. The scent faded as soon as it washed off. 

I have also ordered Bay Rum with this and I DO like the smell of that right out of the box. Haven't used it yet as I am going 1 bar at a time. But I'm disappointed in the weakness of the Pine Tar.

I've been using Dr. Squatch since January, when I got a few bars of soap for a Christmas gift. Pine tar is my favorite, but all of them are great on my skin. No more scratchy, dry skin! Even more amazing was that it left my shower cleaner too. So, I thought I'd branch out and try the shampoo and conditioner. All I can say is... Awesome! I was a little unsure about the recommended usage, but only using the shampoo 3 times a week and the conditioner every day has been great. My hair used to get oily quickly, but this stuff has changed that. Makes me wonder if the shampoo I was using was really working. I love the manly scent, especially on the conditioner. That cool feeling it leaves behind is refreshing. We have very hard water here, but my hair has never been cleaner, and it so much easier to style. On the day I used both the soap and the shampoo and conditioner, I chopped 2 cords of wood and tamed the coyote pack living behind my house, in just one hour. We hang out and tell stories. Good stuff. So good in fact, that I'm buying extra, just in case.
Fits soap perfectly. I thought it was just for setting the soap on but once the soap gets wet then dries to the wood, you can use the wood as the soap handle..if that makes sense

My scalp get dry and flaky a lot and I've tried a wide range of products for men such as Head and shoulders, dove care, axe, selsun Blue, old spice, and even Suave. At the end of the day they all left my hair flaky, dry and itchy. Dr Squatch is the first to leave my hair soft, non flaky and feeling amazing for days to come. I try to conditioner my hair everyday as Dr squatch has mentioned above but some days I don't and I'll go 2 days without doing it and my hair still feels soft and not dry or flaky and that's including me only shampooing my hair twice in a week. This stuff is truly amazing and will be all that I use now on and possibly for ever.

review_title: Nothing special, has some value though. 2 stars, might buy more...
review_content:
This is the most abrasive bar of soap ever. I say that in a good way. It's like having a belt sander in your shower. Any dead skin cells and dirt deposits don't stand a chance against this scrub. Some people may not like that. I love it.

The let down, for me, is in the fragrance, or lack there of. It smells very, very good if you sniff the bar, but the smell does not translate to the skin at all. After drying off, it's almost gone. By the time I get to work (30 minutes later) my skin smells like nothing. No good woodsy "Dr. Squatch" type of...anything. 

As a skin exfoliation bar, I absolutely LOVE IT!!! My problem areas (exfoliation-wise) are never a problem when I use this. I will say however that, when I use it, my butthole seems more itchy soon after then when I use some regular-ass soap from the store like "Coast" or "Dial" or even "Lever 2000". 

The smell claims are why I bought this product. They were... dissapointing. The exfoliation properties may make me buy more. (maybe, it's really that good) 

Buy this product if you have issues with dry skin that the commercially availible soaps are too "soft" for. Don't expect to smell any better.

I was breaking out with horrible rash all over my body and other soaps were causing it to get worse. I heard about dr. Squatch and thought it was expensive and very skeptic because every company claims their product is the best. But I am a believer now. The scents are amazing and last a long time. I never felt cleaner coming out the shower. And my rash is slowly disappearing and I've only been using the soap for a week now. If you want a great soap Dr. Squatch is the way to go!!!!
I have troubled skin and this feels amazing and doesnt clog my pores like axe or those others guys stuff does. Will continue to be a customer and hopefully try every single bar you have!!

I've been squatchin' for about a month now and I have to be honest...I wasn't sure what to expect in the beginning. I was drawn in by the scent names and actually having ingredients that I could pronounce properly but I wasn't sure how well these soaps would work. I signed up for the soapscription with a code that got me 25% off my first box and let Squatch pick my two scents. This was one of the two. I am very pleased I was sent this one first! It feels AMAZING on my skin and the scent it so refreshing. I actually get excited to take a shower when I know I am using this soap! Thanks Squatch! You've earned a customer for life!
Use only if you wish to smell like a god. Side effects include having your wife/girlfriend fawn over you while you're using it or fresh out of the shower.

I hate writing reviews, if a product is bad i never buy it again, plain and simple, But yea, here i am, So, after 3 weeks having discovered this website i decided to try it and bought a few bars. and well shit. I'm here writing a review, Ive tried almost everything on the market, Axe, Irish spring, Old Spice, even a few off brands and they all left me feeling like i had a film on my skin, i smelled clean, but yea, but shit, the first shower, the FIRST shower i used this soap and it was a world of difference, i FELT clean, no residue, no film, no just "ick" feeling, CLEAN, im impressed, as long as they product is around, this is ALL im ever buying again, im a solid believer

I would like to say that I'm a bit disappointed with this soap. Although it is supposed to have the citrus scent, I did not get that AT ALL. The smell of mint and cedar takes over, like there is no orange present. I feel a bit deceived with my first try at this company. The soap goes on pretty well. You don't need to use much, but the scent does not stick after the shower. I want to try more scents to give the company a chance to redeem themselves, but $10 is too much to waste. Not sure if I will try another.

Well after a week of using this I'm sold on it. Feel cleaner, cleans better, smells better, and smell lasts longer than any other soap I've used. And not only that me doin a good but of mechanic work I get pretty oily and greasy at times and this stuff cuts right through it like it's nothing. Amazing product.

I rarely used conditioner prior to using the DrSquatch hair products. My hair feels softer and thicker after using the shampoo and conditioner, my barber even noticed a difference. My girl loves running her fingers through my hair now and comments every time we’re together.
Their Pine Tar soap is the cure for cruddy old skin. My skin is still old but after two weeks using the soap, it is no longer cruddy.

review_title: The best shampoo and conditioner I've used
review_content: I love this shampoo and conditioner set. I used to wash my hair every other day with the regular stuff and it would leave it dry and my scalp a little irritated. But after switching to the Dr Squatch shampoo and conditioner my scalp and hair feel and look way better. Only giving 4 stars though because my brother keeps using it so i have to buy it more frequently.
Works great on my hair, but has chemically scent.

my 1st and so far favorite bar the sent is powerful but not overpowering and very good scrub texture could be rough for someone with sensitive skin and i wish the bars had a larger size but all around a decent product.
This was the second bar I've tried its probably the closes to a scent you'd find in a store and i love the moisturizer and how it makes my skin feel
my 3rd and the bar im on now the scent is great and it gets a very deep scrub that feels very clean i wish they made XL versions i would get this one
This is a great way to try out this line of products and the soap saver is a nice extra the should make a bundle with smaller versions and all the scents so you can find the one you like the most

This soap has an incredible scent....rich, spicy, and the lather is incredible. I have dry skin, especially in the winter, and this soap seems to moisturize my skin. Will always be one of my favorite Squatch soaps.

review_title: Smells good BUT does not last very long at all.
review_content: I have to be honest I liked the smell of the soap, but for $7 per bar I was expecting a lot more out of this bar of soap than 2 weeks total out of it. I was hoping for at least the same amount of time as I get out of a bar of dove especially how big this bar is when you get it. Just for clarification I used a soap saver too with it so it wasn't sitting in water for any extended period of time or anything it just simply does not last. If I had the money to blow on soap sure it smells and cleans nice but I am not gonna pay $7 a bar for something that just doesn't last like it should.

If you haven't tried these soaps, you're missing out. My favorites are Cedar Citrus, Gold Moss and (for that extra clean feeling) pine tar. I suggest once you choose your subscription to choose Squatch picks that way you can try them all. Seriously get your subscription today.
Smells like I showerd in pine sap! I love that the scent is very strong. It didn't smell that good just smelling it but once you lather it on.......You'll be caught in the pines :thinking:
Just smelling from the box it smells better than pine tar at first but it's weak. I could barley smell it during the shower, even less afterwards.

review_title: A mix of campfire and cigarette smoke.
review_content: If musky smokey scents is your thing then go for it. I gave a low review because it's strong at first but even just driving it's almost completely gone after 10 minutes just driving.

review_title: Loved the scent while it lasted.
review_content: Loved the scent but it's so weak after about 10 minutes. I tried it on my beard,wrist and clothes. At 42 dollars and the sample being so faint quickly I'm a little hesitant to buy a full size bit I did love the scent.

I am a very recent first time buyer of Squatch products. This Pine Tar scent is awesome! I work 12 hour shifts in an environment that is dirty, dusty, and all things in between. This soap not only is an awesome scent to wake up to in the shower, but it is equally great if not better when coming home from work to wash away all the day's dirt. It also makes my bathroom smell great just having the bar in my shower. I wish you guys made jar candles in this same Pine Tar scent because I would totally buy it and it would make my whole place smell awesome. I also received my order very quickly, only 3 days in fact. I also ordered the Bay Rum scent and will do another review for it when I start using it. I plan to only buy my soap from Dr. Squatch from now on!
i was pleasantly surprised when i tried this soap. love the scent, made my skin softer and love the scrubbing of the oatmeal. . the only thing is the scent doesnt stay long.
once again Dr. Squatch comes in with a win. like the scent, skin felt clean and soft. scent doesnt last long.
they come in with yet another win. the aloe really makes for soft skin and it lathers up very nicely.

im only on my second month of the soapscription. i have gotten to try 3 different bars so far. they all have their own very distinct scents which i like a lot so far. they all have great lather and leave a nice fresh clean feeling on the skin. the only thing is, after i get out of the shower the scent doesnt last long after the shower. i have been getting almost exactly 2 weeks per bar. i will continue getting soap from Dr. Squatch. i recently just ordered the shampoo and conditioner. i expect the i will be just as satisfied as with the soaps

review_title: DR. Squatch is absolutely the BEST!
review_content: Pin Tar for the win! I’ve tried so many products that I can’t even count that high LOL. But no more, because you guys make the absolute best soap on the market!!!! No one can come close to you all!!! Thank u soooo much for the great customer service to the extremely fast shipping!! U all are Rawkin!!!!!
By far my favorite scent out of all of the soaps! Amazing smell and leaves my skin feeling clean and smooth.
This soap is a game changer. The soap smells amazing and leaves you feeling great. Highly recommend it.

First off, this soap is as black as a moonless night and leaves a dark residue in your shower. Make sure you rinse your shower well before it sticks or you'll have a bit of scrubbing to do. That doesn't detract from it though. The scent is very strong but doesn't leave that strong smell on your skin. There's only a light hint of pine once you rinse off. It lathers up very nicely and is great for cleaning your beard and even your scalp. This soap really stands out as an exfoliation tool. It has oatmeal and sand in it so it will remove a lot of dead skin while you scrub. You will FEEL clean after using this bar of soap! Highly recommended.

This soap is very mild both in feel and scent. The scent is mostly neutral with a hint of sweetness. It is pleasant in a simple, easy-to-appreciate way. The scent doesn't scream at you after your bath either which is a big plus. It's great for an every day soap. This soap really shines when you're shaving too. It produces a thick, smooth lather that clings to your skin. It does a fantastic job of lubricating your skin and helping your razor glide smoothly. I'll definitely be getting more of this!

This soap sucks. Lasts about 10 days and doesn’t smell that good. Also, they sent me only one bar for a two bar subscription and when I contacted them, they just kept saying they’d get back to me and never did. This company is a joke and I am the fourth of my friends to bail on them. Don’t waste your time or money. Seriously.
Fair at best dries out fast causing more friction then needed but does it work? Yes it will get the job done as long as you prep properly.

I have sensitive skin so most cologne makes me itch and turns me red. Not this stuff though. It doesn't cause me any discomfort and smells fantastic. I've gotten several compliments while wearing this scent already and it's only been about a week. While the scent is very nice it isn't loud or outlandish. It's very down-to-earth and subtle. On my skin, the citrus scent comes out pretty strong to start and then slowly gives way to the scent of evergreen. I've found my cologne from now on I think.

My hair has always been a problem for me. In the week that I've been using this conditioner my hair has become much more manageable. It's softer and shinier. I'm diggin' it! This conditioner also smells great which is an added bonus while your using it. My entire bathroom smells like this conditioner when I get done. It's a clean, smooth scent that I liked from the first time that I smelled it. Well worth the money.

After I used this shampoo, my hair and scalp were squeaky clean. LITERALLY. My hair squeaked after I rinsed and ran my hand through my hair. It strips, captures, and lifts every bit of oil and dirt off of your head without leaving any residue. I wouldn't be surprised if this shampoo was able to take ink stains out of a white shirt. All joking aside, make sure that you use the conditioner after using this. Your hair will thank you. Also, this shampoo smells even better than the conditioner. That is no small feat because the conditioner smells great. Another product that is well worth the money.

review_title: Nice soap but not a fan of the smell.
review_content: The soap itself is fine and i like the exfoliation but the smell just reminds me of something like a muscle rub. Out of the six different bars i ordered i wish i had not ordered two of these on the exfoliation factor alone.
Pretty much the all natural version of Irish spring soap. Very refreshing
